0.title: Many BJP workers secretly support AAP in Gujarat: Kejriwal
0.article_body: Many BJP leaders and workers in Gujarat secretly support AAP and want to see the defeat of their own party in the upcoming Assembly elections, Delhi CM and AAP national convenor Arvind Kejriwal said on Sunday. "After 27 years, people want hope because they got nothing but corruption and misgovernance in all these years," Kejriwal said at a rally.

1.title: Katrina may look innocent, but she’s a prankster: Siddhant Chaturvedi
1.article_body: Actor Siddhant Chaturvedi said his 'Phone Bhoot' co-star Katrina Kaif "might look innocent, but she's a prankster". Siddhant also called Katrina "one of the most hardworking actresses" he's worked with. "It was fun working with her. She was very loving. Got to learn a lot from her," he said. 'Phone Bhoot' also stars Ishaan Khatter.

2.title: It’s off the table: Dwayne Johnson on 2024 US Presidential run
2.article_body: Actor Dwayne Johnson has confirmed that the idea of running for the 2024 US Presidential elections is "off the table". Johnson shared that he's been approached by "most influential" political personalities "asking and supporting" him to run for President. But while he's grateful for the opportunity, Dwayne said, "I'm not a politician nor have I ever aspired to be one."

3.title: No desire to be involved in wars: Musk after his proposals on Ukraine-Russia, China-Taiwan
3.article_body: After suggesting a possible peace deal to end the war between Russia and Ukraine and to diffuse China-Taiwan tensions, the world’s richest person Elon Musk remarked, "I have no desire to become involved in wars." Responding to a Twitter user, Musk added, "But it is safe to say that all bets are off if the nukes start flying."

4.title: What father earned, Uddhav lost in minutes: NCP's Khadse on Sena symbol freeze
4.article_body: Referring to the freezing of Shiv Sena's name and symbol by the Election Commission, NCP leader Eknath Khadse said, "What the father had earned with a lot of difficulties is lost by the son in minutes in [a] political fight." Khadse added, "Uddhav Thackeray came to power with this symbol but everything is lost now in the fight."

5.title: Lena Headey, known for playing Cersei in 'Game of Thrones', marries for 3rd time
5.article_body: Actress Lena Headey, best known for playing Cersei Lannister in 'Game of Thrones', has married actor Marc Menchaca in a private ceremony in Italy. This is Lena's third wedding as she was previously married to musician Peter Paul Loughran and director Dan Cadan. GoT actors Peter Dinklage, Nikolaj Coster-Waldau, Emilia Clarke, Sophie Turner and Conleth Hill attended the wedding.

6.title: Sushmita Sen was my first choice: Shreegauri Sawant on her biopic
6.article_body: Transgender activist Shreegauri Sawant said Sushmita Sen was her first choice to play her character in her upcoming biopic 'Taali'. "One should think about how challenging the role will be for a woman with such stature," she said. Shreegauri added that Sushmita has shown courage in taking up the role, which "comes with a lot of taboos".

7.title: 3 people steal food, ₹4,000 from Pune food delivery executive; probe on
7.article_body: Pune Police are looking to catch three persons who allegedly stole food, ₹4,000 cash and valuables from a food delivery executive on Friday night. The victim said that the accused also assaulted him and beat him up with a sharp weapon. Police are collecting the CCTV evidence in the case. A case has also been registered.

8.title: 2 teens who went for picnic drown in check dam in Ranga Reddy
8.article_body: Two teenagers drowned in a check dam in Ranga Reddy's Pedda Amberpet after they went for a picnic with their friends on Sunday. The incident occurred when four members of the group were drowning after they decided to enter the water and some people who were present managed to rescue two of them, according to reports. A case was filed.

9.title: Structural, fire audit ordered in Mumbai's post-mortem centres, mortuaries
9.article_body: Police surgeon Dr Kapil Patil ordered structural, fire and electrical audits of five post-mortem centres in Mumbai. The step was taken after Patil, during his inspection, found that the centres were in bad condition. As per Patil, the waiting room was stuffed with construction material, there was no arrangement for drinking water and lack of forensic experts in the centres.

10.title: Elon Musk reveals how Tesla caught employee who leaked data in 2008
10.article_body: Tesla CEO Elon Musk has revealed how the company caught an employee who leaked confidential data and sold it to a news outlet in 2008. "We sent what appeared to be identical emails to all, but each was...coded with either one or two spaces between sentences, forming a binary signature that identified the leaker," explained Musk in a tweet.

11.title: 1 dead, 2 injured after massive blast at Uran power plant in Navi Mumbai
11.article_body: One person was killed and two others were injured in a massive blast that took place in a power generation plant in Uran in Navi Mumbai. Reports said that the boiler pump exploded at the gas turbine power station and triggered a fire. Maharashtra State Power Generation Company has said that the boiler has been shut for a while.

12.title: 2-year-old girl run over by man reversing his car in Delhi's Rohini
12.article_body: A two-year-old girl was killed after a man, who was reversing his car, ran over her in Rohini's Sector-16 in Delhi at around 1:00 pm on Sunday. Police said the child was playing on the road outside her house when she was hit by her neighbour's car. The car's driver has been apprehended and is being questioned.

13.title: Thane woman given abortion pills after wrong sonography report, dies
13.article_body: A 28-year-old pregnant woman died after she was given abortion pills based on a wrong sonography report in Thane's Kalyan. A doctor allegedly issued the report stating that the baby's growth was not proper and hence she was given pills, leading to her death. Meanwhile, police have registered an offence of culpable homicide not amounting to murder against the doctor.

14.title: Power supply to Zaporizhzhia nuclear plant restored after disruption
14.article_body: The external power supply to the Russian-controlled Zaporizhzhia nuclear power plant was restored on Sunday, Ukraine's state nuclear company Energoatom said. The plant had lost its last remaining line linking it to the power grid early on Saturday due to shelling. The plant had to switch to backup diesel generators for its own needs, such as cooling the reactor blocks.

15.title: Delhi reports 79 fresh COVID-19 cases, no deaths in 24 hours
15.article_body: Delhi recorded 79 new cases of COVID-19 with a positivity rate of 1.52% in the last 24 hours, the city health department informed on Sunday. No deaths due to the infection were reported in the national capital. The city's active case count stood at 385, as per the daily COVID-19 bulletin. Delhi's total case tally reached 20,04,120.

16.title: Stray dog bites former Kerala MLA and 3 others in Palakkad, caught
16.article_body: Former Palakkad MLA KK Divakaran and three other persons, including a child, were bitten by a stray dog in the Noorani Thondikulam area of Kerala on Saturday. As per reports, the dog first bit Divakaran's leg and when he tried to escape, it bit him again on his hands. All four are reportedly undergoing treatment at the district hospital.

17.title: Hyderabad & Mumbai City play out 3-3 draw to kick off ISL campaign
17.article_body: Defending champions Hyderabad FC and Mumbai City FC played out a 3-3 draw at the Shree Shiv Chhatrapati Sports Complex in Pune to kick off their respective 2022-2023 ISL campaigns. Mumbai scored first but Hyderabad levelled the scores with a penalty just before half-time. After Hyderabad took the lead in the second half, Mumbai equalised in the 85th minute.

18.title: India to host UNSC members for key counter-terror meet on Oct 28, 29
18.article_body: India will host diplomats from all the UNSC member states for a key meeting of the Counter-Terrorism Committee (CTC) in Mumbai and New Delhi on October 28-29. "Members of the UN CTC will pay homage to victims of 26/11 terror attacks in Mumbai," India's Permanent Representative to the UN said. India is currently Chair of the Security Council Counter-Terrorism Committee.

19.title: Amul to be merged with 5 other cooperative societies: Amit Shah
19.article_body: Minister of Co-operation Amit Shah said that Amul will be merged with five other cooperative societies to form a multi-state cooperative society (MSCS) and added that the merger process has already commenced. Shah added that the government is giving priority to natural and digital agriculture. The MSCS will certify the product and ensure their export, Amit Shah said.

20.title: Team India players attend Australia-England T20I in Perth, Ashwin shares pic
20.article_body: Team India T20 World Cup squad players, including Ravichandran Ashwin, Harshal Patel, Yuzvendra Chahal and Dinesh Karthik, attended the first Australia-England T20I in Perth on Sunday. Ashwin took to Instagram Stories to share a picture. Notably, Perth is Team India's base for the T20 World Cup 2022. England defeated Australia by 8 runs in the match.

21.title: Super pumped, motivated to end the season: Djokovic on back-to-back titles
21.article_body: When asked if his hunger for titles went up after missing a big phase of the season, Novak Djokovic, who won back-to-back titles in Tel Aviv and Astana, said, "Well, it did." He added, "I couldn't ask for a better restart to the season. More than three months since...Wimbledon final." He further said, "I'm super pumped...motivated to end the season."

22.title: 185 including 19 children killed in Iran protests: Rights group
22.article_body: At least 185 people, including at least 19 children, have been killed in the crackdown on protests across Iran that were sparked by Mahsa Amini's death, Norway-based Iran Human Rights said on Saturday. "The highest...killings occurred in Sistan and Baluchistan province with half the recorded number," the group added. Tehran holds that the protests are a ploy by Iran's enemies.

23.title: When I went into bat, felt that wicket was playing good: Shreyas on his 113*
23.article_body: After his unbeaten 113 runs off 111 balls in India's seven-wicket win against South Africa in second ODI, batter Shreyas Iyer said he felt the wicket was playing good when he came to bat. "The talk between me and Ishan Kishan was to play the ball on merit, build a partnership," he added. Shreyas was adjudged 'Player of the Match'.

24.title: Was in God's hands: Sainz on crashing during rain-hit Japanese GP
24.article_body: Ferrari F1's Carlos Sainz said he was "in God's hands" after he crashed his car during the rain-hit Japanese Grand Prix. "When I stopped in the middle of the track and the other cars were coming. I knew they couldn't see me," said Sainz. He added that the "conditions were impossible" and the race should have been a rolling start.

25.title: Chinese ambassador to US thanks Musk for Taiwan proposal
25.article_body: China's ambassador to the US thanked Tesla CEO Elon Musk for his proposal suggesting that Taiwan's dispute with China could be resolved by handing over Beijing some control. The Chinese ambassador took to Twitter to thank Musk for "his idea about establishing a special administrative zone for Taiwan". China has offered Taiwan a system of "one country, two systems".

26.title: Aaron Finch breaks Rohit's world record, takes fewest balls to reach 3,000 T20I runs
26.article_body: Australia T20I captain Aaron Finch has broken the world record for taking the fewest number of balls to reach 3,000 runs in T20I cricket, achieving the feat in the first T20I against England on Sunday. The 35-year-old took 2,078 deliveries to reach the 3,000-run mark. He overtook India captain Rohit Sharma, who had taken 2,149 deliveries to reach the milestone.

27.title: 1 killed, 4 rescued after wall of under-construction mall in Mohali collapses
27.article_body: The wall of an under-construction showroom at Mohali City Centre being built on Mohali Airport road collapsed on Sunday, leading to the death of one labourer. Of the eight labourers who were trapped under the wall's debris, four have been rescued and sent to a hospital, police said. Earthmovers and ambulances have been deployed to rescue remaining labourers.

28.title: Video of crane on track during F1 race goes viral, driver says 'I was 2m away from dying'
28.article_body: A video of a crane on track during Formula One Japanese Grand Prix has gone viral. Scuderia AlphaTauri driver Pierre Gasly was heard telling his team, "Why is...tractor on track? It's unacceptable." He later said in an interview, "I was two metres away from dying." Notably, Jules Bianchi died during Japanese Grand Prix 2014 after colliding with recovery vehicle.

29.title: 2 drown as boat capsizes in UP's Gorakhpur
29.article_body: Two people died and five were rescued after the boat in which they were travelling capsized in the Rapti river near Newarpatti village in Gorakhpur, UP. The boat, which was carrying seven passengers, including a woman, started sinking due to strong waves, police said. The deceased were identified as Baliram Singh and Brijesh Yadav.

30.title: OPEC has sovereign right to decide on oil production: Hardeep Puri
30.article_body: Union Petroleum Minister Hardeep Singh Puri has said OPEC has a sovereign right to decide on the oil production capacities. "[It's] their sovereign right to decide what they wish to do, how much oil they want to produce...how much they want to put into...market," he said. His remarks came after OPEC+ agreed to cut oil production by two million barrels/day.

31.title: Schools in Lucknow, Kanpur, Meerut & Hapur closed tomorrow amid heavy rains
31.article_body: All schools till Class 12 in Uttar Pradesh's Lucknow, Kanpur, Meerut and Hapur districts will remain closed on Monday in view of heavy rainfall prediction. This comes after the district administration in Aligarh announced that all schools will be closed till October 12. The India Meteorological Department (IMD) has predicted heavy rainfall in the state in the next few days.

32.title: Woman who helped Sidhu Moosewala murder accused escape arrested from Mumbai airport
32.article_body: Punjab Police have arrested a woman accomplice of Deepak Tinu, an accused in the Sidhu Moosewala murder case, from Mumbai airport. According to Punjab Police, the woman had helped Deepak in escaping the custody of the Crime Investigation Agency (CIA) from Mansa. Acting on intelligence input, Punjab Police nabbed the woman while she was on her way to the Maldives.

33.title: My favourite New Zealand cricketer is Ross Taylor: Union Minister Jaishankar
33.article_body: Union Minister S Jaishankar said that his favourite New Zealand cricketer is Ross Taylor. During his first visit to New Zealand as a foreign minister, Jaishankar said, "They (Indians) will never forget John Wright," Jaishankar said. He added, "I would say the New Zealander best known to Indians would be [Kane] Williamson. We like him most of the time."

34.title: Shreyas Iyer, Ishan Kishan smash their highest scores in ODI cricket
34.article_body: Shreyas Iyer and Ishan Kishan on Sunday smashed their highest scores in ODI cricket during the second ODI against South Africa in Ranchi. Ishan, whose previous highest score was 59(42) against Sri Lanka, slammed 93(84) on Sunday, while Shreyas smashed an unbeaten 113 off 111 deliveries. Shreyas' previous highest score was 103(107) against New Zealand, which came in 2020.

35.title: Won't work with Reynolds, he was horrifically mean to me on Deadpool set: Miller
35.article_body: Actor-comedian TJ Miller, who featured in 'Deadpool', said he'll never work with actor Ryan Reynolds again. "We had a...weird moment on 'Deadpool' where he said, 'Let's do one more take'...then as the character, he was horrifically mean to me," he added. Miller stated, "He said...'You're not the star, but you do...enough exposition so that it's funny...and...we can...get back to...real movie.'"

36.title: Wish you more luck than I had: Alonso on Verstappen winning 2nd world title
36.article_body: Alpine F1 driver Fernando Alonso congratulated Max Verstappen on becoming a two-time world champion after the Red Bull driver won the Japanese GP. "Welcome to the club...I wish you have more luck than what I had," said Alonso, who has also won two championships. Alonso added he was hoping Verstappen and Red Bull have "more competition" next year.

37.title: I went to my room & started bawling: YouTuber 'Dream' on meeting fans for first time
37.article_body: Popular Minecraft streamer 'Dream', who recently revealed his identity as a 23-year-old boy named Clay from the US in a YouTube video, met his fans in person for the first time at a Twitch event. When the moderator asked how he was, he said, "I'm shaking". Later in an interview, he said, "I went to my room and started bawling."

38.title: Kangana, Taapsee have a spine, won't be surprised if they end up in politics: Gul
38.article_body: Actress Gul Panag said in an interview that Kangana Ranaut and Taapsee Pannu are the two women who have the spine to make it into politics. "I don't agree with everything that Kangana says...but the woman has a spine...Taapsee has it too and I won't be surprised if those two end up in active politics...later on," Gul added.

39.title: Chiranjeevi-starrer 'GodFather' collects over ₹100 crore worldwide
39.article_body: Ram Charan's Konidela Production Company took to Twitter and said that Chiranjeevi-starrer 'GodFather' has collected over ₹100 crore worldwide. 'GodFather' is a remake of the 2019 Malayalam film 'Lucifer', which featured Mohanlal. 'GodFather', which was released on October 5, also has a cameo of actor Salman Khan. The film earned ₹38 crore on the first day of its release.

40.title: Broad, his wife expecting their 1st child; likely to skip Pak Test tour
40.article_body: English cricketer Stuart Broad and his wife, Mollie King, are reportedly expecting the birth of their first child due to which the seamer is likely to miss the Test tour of Pakistan in December. According to the Daily Mail, Broad has informed the selectors about the same. "I will obviously want to be at home deep into November," Broad said.

41.title: Meta to notify Facebook users against apps stealing login details
41.article_body: Facebook's parent company Meta said that it has identified more than 400 apps which stole login credentials of users. "We are also alerting people who may have unknowingly self-compromised their accounts by downloading these apps and sharing their credentials," Meta said. It said that Google and Apple had been notified about these malicious apps available on their app stores.

42.title: Is this a way to treat the national animal: Randeep on video of people stomping on tiger
42.article_body: Sharing a video of people stomping on a tiger, who was shot and later died, in Bihar's Champaran region, actor Randeep Hooda tweeted, "Is this a way to treat the national animal?" Randeep stated the Bihar forest department chose to deploy private hunter to kill the "problem tiger" ignoring National Tiger Conservation Authority's SOP. The tiger had killed nine people.

43.title: Nuclear war probability is rising rapidly: Elon Musk
43.article_body: The world's richest man and Tesla CEO Elon Musk on Sunday tweeted, "Nuclear war probability is rising rapidly." Responding to the billionaire's tweet, his mother Maye Musk tweeted, "My Ukrainian and Russian friends have been saying this for months." Earlier, Musk ran a Twitter poll with his suggestions for Russia-Ukraine peace, in which 59% of respondents rejected Musk's suggestions.

44.title: Was looking at myself, was thrilled: Prabhas on watching Adipurush teaser in 3D
44.article_body: Actor Prabhas recently attended an event in Hyderabad where the teaser of 'Adipurush' was screened in 3D for the first time. Speaking at the event, Prabhas said, "I was looking at myself in 3D for the first time - those visuals, the animals charging, I felt very thrilled." He added that the film is made for the big screen.

45.title: Our plan was to take on bowlers in first 10 overs: Shikhar on India's win
45.article_body: Following India's seven wicket-win against South Africa in second ODI, India captain Shikhar Dhawan said, "Our plan was to take on the bowlers in the first ten overs." "But once the dew came into the picture, it was skidding on. So the back-foot shots were easy to execute," he added. India have levelled the three-match ODI series 1-1.

46.title: Mbappe like an orphan without Messi and Neymar: PSG manager
46.article_body: PSG manager Christophe Galtier said forward Kylian Mbappe "was a bit like an orphan without" fellow strikers Lionel Messi and Neymar during the team's match against Stade de Reims on Sunday. "I thought that might change as the game went on," said Galtier. He added that Mbappe was up against a "goalkeeper who made a decisive save".

47.title: Djokovic wins 90th career title after beating Tsitsipas in Astana Open final
47.article_body: Novak Djokovic claimed the 90th title of his career after defeating Stefanos Tsitsipas in Astana Open final on Sunday. "I always hoped that I would be going to have a great career...my intention was always to reach the highest heights," said Djokovic. The fourth seed won 6-3, 6-4 to make it his ninth consecutive match victory.

48.title: High quality knock: Ian Bishop on Shreyas' 113* in 2nd ODI vs SA
48.article_body: Ian Bishop took to Twitter following India batter Shreyas Iyer's ton against South Africa in second ODI and wrote, "High quality knock from Shreyas Iyer given the short ball challenges he has battled." The 27-year-old scored 113* runs off 111 balls. He hit 15 fours during his knock. Shreyas was adjudged 'Player of the Match' in India's seven-wicket win.

49.title: Conflict complaint filed against Sandeep Patil over MCA President nomination
49.article_body: A conflict of interest complaint has been filed against former cricketer Sandeep Patil after he filed his nomination for Mumbai Cricket Association (MCA) President's post. The complainant said Patil is a relative of Salil Ankola, the MCA senior men's selection committee chairman. "I want to talk about cricket...Nothing else," said Patil when asked about the complaint.

50.title: Cong is a divided house in Himachal Pradesh: Anurag Thakur
50.article_body: Union Minister Anurag Thakur said that the opposition Congress is a "divided house" in Himachal Pradesh as two of the four Working Presidents of the party's state unit have joined BJP. The BJP MP from Hamirpur directed the authorities to identify land for a sports ground in Bhota so that the youth can get a proper facility to play.

51.title: Half-burnt body of minor girl found in Haryana's Kaithal district
51.article_body: The half-burnt body of a seven-year-old girl, who went missing on Saturday, was found in a forest area in Haryana's Kaithal district on Sunday, police said. The girl had reportedly gone missing after she went to answer nature's call. Police were informed of the minor's disappearance after family members and residents of Kurad village failed to locate her, PTI reported.

52.title: What is hanging solar fence installed by Odisha govt to protect elephants?
52.article_body: Odisha government has installed a 750-metre-long hanging solar fence along railway tracks to protect elephants crossing the tracks. The fence will keep elephants and other wild animals from crossing the tracks by giving them a brief yet strong shock when they come in contact with it. The 10,000-volt fence will be solar-powered and have no current, making its shock non-fatal.

53.title: No one can ever take that away: US' Fritz on entering top 10 of ATP rankings
53.article_body: World number 11 Taylor Fritz said entering the top 10 in ATP rankings is always one of the goals that one has as a kid. The 24-year-old American will be making his top 10 debut on Monday. "I wanna go even higher but top 10 is such a huge achievement...no one can ever take that away from me," he added.

54.title: 3 teenagers dead in collision between bike, tractor-trolley in UP
54.article_body: Three people died after a bike collided with a tractor-trolley on a highway in UP's Pilibhit. The deceased, Mohammad Umair (18), Uwais (16) and Mohammad Ayan (14), were residents of Bareilly district, police said. All of them were rushed to a hospital where they succumbed to their injuries and the bodies were later sent for post-mortem examination, police added.

55.title: OPEC oil cuts 'unhelpful & unwise' for global economy: Janet Yellen
55.article_body: US Treasury Secretary Janet Yellen called the decision of the OPEC+  to cut oil production "unhelpful and unwise" for the global economy. Speaking to the Financial Times, Yellen said, "We're very worried about developing countries and the problems they face." She added that keeping prices low was particularly helpful for countries suffering due to high energy prices.

56.title: India will stand out with 7% growth rate in FY23: EAC member
56.article_body: A member of the Economic Advisory Council to the PM, Sanjeev Sanyal, on Sunday said, "We are...entering an environment where many countries...will be facing much slower growth or even slipping into recession." "Under those circumstances, India's performance will stand out as being perhaps...strongest of any major economy in...world with around 7% GDP growth rate in current fiscal year," he added

57.title: Jaypee Group firms call board meeting tomorrow over divestment plans
57.article_body: Jaypee Group's two firms Jaiprakash Associates Ltd (JAL) and Jaiprakash Power Ventures Ltd (JPVL) announced their board of directors will be meeting tomorrow to be apprised about the company's divestment plans. JPVL noted that the meeting was "regarding proposals of divestment of Nigrie Cement Grinding Unit" and to "review the progress made in the reduction of company's debt".

58.title: WWE star Sara Lee shared her mirror selfie from gym on Instagram hours before she died
58.article_body: Ex-WWE wrestler Sara Lee, who passed away aged 30 on October 6, had posted a mirror selfie from a gym hours before her death. "Celebrating finally being healthy enough to go to...gym 2 days in a row...first-ever sinus infection kicked my butt #Saraselfie #gains," she had written in the caption. The cause of her death is yet to be disclosed.

59.title: Don't hit my wife, she's pregnant: Iranian man in viral video amid protests
59.article_body: A video posted by 1500tasvir on Instagram showed a man shouting "don't hit my wife, she is pregnant," while trying to protect her from riot police in Iran on Saturday. The couple was reportedly arrested after being beaten. Iran Human Rights said around 185 people, including 19 children, have been killed in anti-government protests after the death of Mahsa Amini.

60.title: Aishwaryaa to direct father Rajinikanth's 173rd film: Report
60.article_body: Rajinikanth's daughter Aishwaryaa Rajinikanth will reportedly be directing the South star in his 173rd film. This is the first time Aishwaryaa will be directing her father. Rajinikanth's younger daughter Soundarya directed the actor in the 2014 animated film 'Kochadaiiyaan', which also featured actress Deepika Padukone. Rajinikanth is next set to feature in 'Jailer'.

61.title: Bangladeshi smuggler gunned down by BSF personnel in West Bengal
61.article_body: A Bangladeshi smuggler was shot dead by BSF personnel at the Bishnupur border outpost in West Bengal's Nadia district on Saturday night, a statement by the BSF said. The deceased was part of an armed gang of cattle smugglers, it added. According to the BSF, its personnel opened fire in self-defence after the gang, involving 15-20 Bangladeshi smugglers, attacked them.

62.title: She may look innocent but she's a prankster: Siddhant on co-star Katrina
62.article_body: Actor Siddhant Chaturvedi, while sharing his experience of working with Katrina Kaif in the upcoming horror-comedy 'Phone Bhoot', said, "It's amazing working with her." "She might look innocent but she's a prankster. She used to prank us a lot as we're juniors also," he added. Siddhant further said Katrina is one of the most hardworking actresses he has worked with.

63.title: It's a good sign that women are also liking 'GodFather': Chiranjeevi
63.article_body: Speaking about his film 'GodFather', actor Chiranjeevi said, "The audience is loving the film...it's a good sign that women are also liking our movie." He added that he himself had said that if the content was good then people would come to watch films in theatres. "After 'Indra'...'Tagore', I'm happy to achieve that level of success with 'GodFather'," he added.

64.title: Uttarakhand's Hemkund Sahib receives fresh snowfall; videos surface
64.article_body: The Hemkund Sahib shrine in Uttarakhand's Garhwal region received fresh snowfall on Sunday. The pilgrimage to the holy shrine was halted on Sunday, a day before its doors were scheduled to close. Several videos have surfaced on social media showing the shrine and its surrounding areas covered in snow.

65.title: 70% of violent incidents are against female environmental activists: Report
65.article_body: According to report by a Special Rapporteur to the UN General Assembly, among 122 reported incidents against environmental and human rights activists, almost 70% are against female activists. In India also, incidents of violence have been reported in the aftermath of disasters such as seasonal flooding in Bihar. The report has claimed that climate crisis aggravates gender-based violence.

66.title: Need to further grow trade with India: Sri Lankan PM Dinesh Gunawardena
66.article_body: Sri Lankan Prime Minister Dinesh Gunawardena met top executives from India and said "there is a need for further growth in bilateral trade and increased Indian investments in new areas," according to his office. Indian CEO Forum-Sri Lanka called on Gunawardena at the PM's Office on Thursday. He thanked Indian companies for their input and support to Sri Lanka's economy.

67.title: 5 hurt, several feared trapped as building collapses near Delhi's Lahori Gate
67.article_body: At least five people have been rescued and around four others are feared trapped under debris after a building collapsed near Delhi's Lahori Gate on Sunday, according to the Delhi Fire Service (DFS). As many as five tenders were rushed to the spot following the incident. The rescued persons, who have sustained injuries, were shifted to a hospital.

68.title: It's tough for Marathi cinema to survive with Hindi in same state: Riteish
68.article_body: Actor Riteish Deshmukh has said that it is tough for Marathi cinema to survive with Hindi cinema in the same state when people prefer to watch Hindi over Marathi films. "When Marathi movies become a second choice, their theatre share invariably goes down...'Lai Bhaari', 'Natsamrat', these films reached the maximum audience. But we need more such films," Riteish added.

69.title: BJP would stoop to cheap politics to win 2024 LS polls: Stalin
69.article_body: After being unanimously elected as DMK President, MK Stalin told party functionaries to focus on the 2024 Lok Sabha elections. "Do not forget that the BJP would go to any extent of cheap politics to win the next LS polls," he alleged. Stalin added that the "BJP is suffocating" in Tamil Nadu as the state won't confuse religion and politics.

70.title: India to accord top priority to national interest in FTA deal: Goyal
70.article_body: Commerce and Industry Minister Piyush Goyal has said that India would accord top priority to national interest in FTA negotiations. "FTAs to be entered into after...consultation with all stakeholders...the government will not diverge from this approach for the sake of deadlines," he said. This comes after UK Home Secretary Suella Braverman said India-UK FTA would increase immigration to the UK.

71.title: Hindi can be medium of instruction in higher education: Panel
71.article_body: A parliamentary panel has recommended that the medium of instruction in technical and non-technical higher education institutes such as IITs in Hindi-speaking states should be Hindi. It added that it should be in local languages in other parts of India. The panel also recommended that Hindi should be one of the official languages of the United Nations.

72.title: Taliban official assassinated in Afghanistan's Faryab province
72.article_body: A Taliban official, Abdul Rahman Munawar, was killed by unknown assailants in Afghanistan's Faryab province on Saturday, local media reported. Another official confirmed the reports and said Munawar, the head of economic affairs in Faryab, was assassinated while he was on his way home. Taliban forces said they have been unable to ascertain the motive behind the murder thus far.

73.title: 6 children drown in pond filled with rainwater in Gurugram
73.article_body: Six children, aged between eight and 13, allegedly drowned in a pond filled with rainwater in Gurugram's Sector 111 on Sunday, according to DM Nishant Kumar Yadav. "We're making announcements in the local area to inform us if any other child is missing," Yadav added. DCP West Deepak Saharan said the children's clothes were found lying outside the pond.

74.title: India beat SA, equal their own record for most wins in international cricket in a year
74.article_body: India defeated South Africa by seven wickets in the second ODI in Ranchi to level the three-match series 1-1. The victory is India's 37th across formats in international cricket in 2022. With this, India equalled their own record for most wins in international cricket in a calendar year. India had registered 37 victories in 2017 as well.

75.title: Knew him from our ad days, could sing exactly as I would ask: Pritam on KK
75.article_body: Music composer Pritam Chakraborty, recalling working with late singer KK, said, "He could sing exactly as I would ask." "I knew him from our advertising days, so I knew what songs suited him the best," he added. Pritam further said KK's death was very shocking. KK passed away at the age of 53 after his concert in May 2022.

76.title: Zomato app down for several users across India
76.article_body: Several users of the food delivery app Zomato from different cities, including Delhi, Bengaluru and Mumbai, took to Twitter on Sunday claiming that the app is down. The app showed a message that read, "We're not accepting orders online. We'll be back soon." According to Downdetector, a spurt in outage was reported by Zomato users from 7:30 pm onwards.

77.title: Video shows Zomato delivery man & Noida society guard hitting each other with sticks
77.article_body: A video has surfaced online which shows a Zomato delivery man and a housing society guard in Noida kicking, punching and hitting each other with sticks. Police said that the fight broke out after the security guard did not allow the delivery man to enter the society. "Both of them have been arrested under section 151 of IPC," police added.

78.title: Why should a transgender play role of transgender: Gauri Sawant on 'Taali'
78.article_body: Transgender activist Gauri Sawant, reacting to conversation on social media around transgender actors not being considered for her role in 'Taali', said, "Why should a transgender play role of transgender?" "People should consider us for other roles," she said, adding, "I did an [ad] where I played...a mother, and people accepted me...Why should [we] be restricted to just...transgender roles?"

79.title: People of Gujarat have blessed me without looking at my caste: PM Modi
79.article_body: Addressing a public rally in Mehsana ahead of the upcoming state Assembly polls, PM Narendra Modi said that the people of Gujarat have blessed him for the last two decades without looking at his caste. "[People blessed me] without looking at my political background," PM Modi said. Notably, PM Modi was the CM of Gujarat between 2001 and 2014.

80.title: No material impact of rate hike on demand for home loans: RBI data
80.article_body: Interest rates don't seem to have a material impact on people seeking home loans as home loan outstanding of banks almost doubled to ₹16.84 lakh crore in last five years, RBI data showed. Banks' housing loan outstanding rose between 13.7-16.4% YoY in FY23's first five months. In the same period, RBI hiked the interest rate thrice by 140 basis points.

81.title: Tej Pratap Yadav leaves RJD meeting midway, says party leader abused him & his sister
81.article_body: RJD supremo Lalu Prasad Yadav's son and Bihar Cabinet Minister Tej Pratap Yadav left the national executive meeting midway and accused party leader Shyam Rajak of abusing him and his sister. He also accused Rajak of being an RSS agent. "A powerful person has right to say whatever he wants...I am from Dalit community. I cannot say anything," Rajak said.

82.title: Formulate regulations to check growth of 'Instagram influencers': HC to Centre
82.article_body: Karnataka High Court has advised the Centre to formulate regulatory measures to check the growth of "pseudo-therapists" and "Instagram influencers". "On social media, therapists pose as if they are in the field of therapy. It is also in public domain that they are pseudo-therapists who are Instagram influencers...In reality, they aren't bound by ethics or regulated by norms," HC said.

83.title: It's not our study material: BYJU'S on incorrect Indian map with 'Azad Kashmir'
83.article_body: BYJU'S has denied that the viral image of an incorrect Indian map bearing the company's name and 'Azad Kashmir' marking wasn't a part of the company's study material. "This is a fake image and not our material," BYJU'S said in a statement. "We strongly condemn the incorrect map of India that's being distributed maliciously with our incorrect logo," it added.

84.title: We've been absolutely on it: Verstappen on defending F1 world c'ship title
84.article_body: After winning the Formula One world championship title for the second consecutive year, Red Bull's Max Verstappen tweeted, "We've been absolutely on it, the whole year." He added, "A season where we had a difficult start but kept it cool, bounced back and never let go." Verstappen clinched the title after winning the Japanese Grand Prix on Sunday.

85.title: Microplastics found in human breast milk for the first time
85.article_body: Microplastics have been found in human breast milk for the first time, according to a research published in the peer-reviewed journal Polymers. An Italian team of researchers took breast milk samples from 34 healthy mothers a week after giving birth and microplastics were detected in 75% of them. The researchers found microplastics composed of polyethylene, PVC and polypropylene.

86.title: Casillas tweets 'I'm gay', Puyol responds 'Time to tell our story'; both delete tweets later
86.article_body: Ex-Spain captain and goalkeeper Iker Casillas on Sunday posted a tweet in Spanish that translated to "I hope you respect me: I'm gay". Responding to his tweet, his ex-Spain teammate Carles Puyol wrote, "The time has come to tell our story...Iker." However, the duo, who were rivals during their time at Barcelona and Real Madrid respectively, deleted their tweets later.

87.title: 1,000 electric vehicles' charging points set up across Delhi: Govt
87.article_body: Delhi government has set up 1,000 electric vehicles' charging points in less than a year under the single window facility. "It's just...beginning as Delhi plans to install 18,000 charging points in...next three years," Transport Minister Kailash Gahlot said. "By 2024-end, Delhi is determined to have one out of every four new vehicles purchased to be an electric vehicle," he added.

88.title: PM Modi inaugurates 3D light & sound show in Gujarat's Sun Temple
88.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi inaugurated a 3D projection light and sound show explaining the importance of the Sun Temple in Gujarat's Modhera on Sunday. He declared Modhera village in Mehsana district India's first 24x7 solar-powered village. "Modhera was known for Sun Temple and now it will also be known as a solar-powered village," PM Modi said.

89.title: India could get chunk of €300 billion fund under EU scheme: French envoy
89.article_body: French Ambassador Emmanuel Lenain said India could receive a chunk of the €300 billion (₹24.21 lakh crore) fund announced by the European Union under its Global Gateway scheme. Lenain said Paris does not want to be "confrontational" but prefers to be "efficient" for the Indo-French convergence. Lenain also said there is a need for an "alternative to the Chinese model".

90.title: Government to commence FY24 budget making exercise on Monday
90.article_body: The government will begin its annual Budget making exercise for financial year 2023-24 on Monday. The meeting would start with consultations with various ministries and departments on the revised estimates (RE) of expenditure for ongoing financial year and the fund requirement for 2023-24. Most of these discussions would be chaired by the Finance Secretary and Expenditure Secretary.

91.title: VIPs caught having alcohol to be kept in special cell with AC in dry Bihar
91.article_body: A special ward has been set up for VIPs caught consuming alcohol in the Samastipur area of Bihar, where liquor is banned. Excise Superintendent SK Chaudhary said a trained dog will also be kept in the special cell for their safety. The special cell will have two beds, air conditioners, a sofa and a table among other amenities.

92.title: We've not come Himachal to sit, but to change its destiny: Nadda
92.article_body: BJP National President JP Nadda has said that BJP has come to Himachal Pradesh to change the destiny of the state. He said, "Elected representatives are sitting here...We've not come here to sit on our seats, we've come to change the image and destiny of Himachal." Earlier, Nadda had said BJP is the only ideology-based and national party in India.

93.title: Puducherry LG is running a parallel govt: AIADMK
93.article_body: Puducherry Lieutenant Governor Tamilisai Soundararajan was criticised by the AIADMK for "running a parallel government" in the Union Territory. Puducherry's AIADMK East Wing convenor A Anbalagan called the LG's open house session to accept petitions from public an "insult to the elected government". The LG had said that people could meet her at Raj Nivas after seeking prior appointment.

94.title: Gandhi family is blessing me, Kharge ji: Tharoor
94.article_body: Congress Presidential polls candidate Shashi Tharoor said that the Gandhi family is blessing him and his opponent Mallikarjun Kharge as well because they are "contesting" for making the Congress party stronger. "My interactions with the Gandhi family have convinced me that there is no bias from them towards either me or Kharge," Tharoor said.

95.title: Was surprised: Pankaj on Election Commission making him national icon
95.article_body: Actor Pankaj Tripathi revealed he was surprised after he was named the national icon by the Election Commission of India. Pankaj added the Election Commission noticed that he's eager to take forward "the message of the importance of democracy". "It's for the love of democracy which has pushed me to contribute and it was acknowledged with the tag," he stated.

96.title: Govt buys 60% more from small businesses in first half of FY23 from year-ago period
96.article_body: According to government data, central public sector enterprises (CPSEs) bought goods worth 60% more from micro and small enterprises (MSEs) in first half of 2022-23 as compared to same period last year. The total amount of public procurement by CPSEs stands at ₹21,256 crore as of October 9. According to the data, procurement was made from 75,120 MSEs this year.

97.title: Banks financing Twitter deal face $500 million in losses: Report
97.article_body: According to a report, several major US and foreign banks could suffer losses of $500 million or more if they financed Elon Musk's $44 billion acquisition of Twitter. Lenders, led by Morgan Stanley and including Barclays and Bank of America, committed to provide $13 billion of debt financing for the deal. Banks agreed to terms with lower returns in April.

98.title: Multiple landslides disrupt road connectivity between Sikkim & Bengal
98.article_body: Heavy rain early on Sunday triggered multiple landslides in Sikkim, which cut off road connectivity between the Northeastern state and West Bengal. Huge boulders have blocked National Highway 10 at two places between Singtam and Rangpo in East Sikkim, an official said. "It may take an entire day to clear the debris and reopen the way for traffic," he added.

99.title: Foreign investors invest ₹2,400 crore in Indian equities in first week of October
99.article_body: According to data from the depositories, foreign portfolio investors (FPI) have invested a net ₹2,440 crore in the domestic equity markets in the first week of October. FPI flow is expected to remain volatile in the coming months on a slew of global and domestic factors, experts said. FPIs had withdrawn over ₹7,600 crore last month.

100.title: India, UAE can benefit from increasing cooperation in different sectors: Report
100.article_body: A Deloitte report said India's and the UAE's economies can benefit significantly from their free trade agreement by sharing knowledge and practices in areas of mutual interest like education, energy and defence. Both countries implemented the Comprehensive Economic Partnership Agreement (CEPA) from May 1. According to the report, UAE has committed to meet India's energy needs at competitive rates.

101.title: TV show director told me, 'TV is about tall, thin, fair girl': Malishka
101.article_body: RJ Malishka Mendonsa opened up about how she overcame her insecurities with body image. "It takes a lot of self-talk, it takes a lot of friends...it takes you trusting yourself eventually...you've to make yourself realize...these are self-imposed doubts," she stated. Malishka said, "One of...directors of a TV show...told me...'Television is all about tall, thin, fair, straight-hair girls'."

102.title: Bowling in nets to class players helped me: Bracewell after NZ's win
102.article_body: Following New Zealand's eight-wicket win over Bangladesh in the tri-series, New Zealand all-rounder Michael Bracewell, who was adjudged 'Player of the Match', said he's happy with his effort. "The experience of bowling to some class players at the nets helped me, it was challenging at times, but exciting as well," he added. Bracewell posted bowling figures of 4-0-14-2.

103.title: US says failed rocket attack targeted its troops in Syria
103.article_body: A rocket fired at a compound in Syria hosting US troops and partnered local forces on Saturday failed to cause any injuries or damage, the US military said. The 107 mm rocket failed to impact anything inside the Rumalyn Landing Zone US compound, it added. The military did not identify anyone who could be responsible for the failed attack.

104.title: Ambuja Cements gets shareholders' nod to raise ₹20,000 crore from Adani Group
104.article_body: Ambuja Cements said it has received shareholders' approval for all proposals in its EGM, including a resolution to raise ₹20,000 crore from Harmonia Trade and Investment, an Adani group firm. Resolutions to appoint Gautam Adani, his son Karan Adani and two directors and four independent directors on the board of Ambuja Cements were also approved by the shareholders.

105.title: Nissan pushing partner Renault to sell down stake, may raise funds: Reports
105.article_body: According to reports, Nissan is pushing Renault to cut its stake in Nissan to as much as 15%, and may consider raising funds to buy back the shares. The demands were made in exchange for Nissan agreeing to invest in Renault's new unit which will house its electric vehicle assets. Reports said the deal would not affect their business alliance.

106.title: Nayanthara and Vignesh Shivan blessed with twin boys, share pics
106.article_body: Actress Nayanthara and filmmaker Vignesh Shivan have been blessed with twin boys. Taking to Instagram to share pictures on behalf of him and Nayanthara, Vignesh revealed they have named the boys 'Uyir' and 'Ulagam'. "All our prayers...our ancestors' blessings combined with all the good manifestations made...have come together in the form of two blessed babies for us," he wrote.

107.title: Forceps left in Kerala woman's stomach during caesarean removed after 5 years
107.article_body: A woman in Kerala has registered a complaint against doctors for leaving forceps inside her body while performing caesarean surgery on her five years ago. Harshina had undergone surgery at Kozhikode Medical College after she began feeling "severe pain". A CT scan revealed there was a metal object in her stomach that was poking at her urinary bladder, causing infection.

108.title: You don't get these type of players daily: Warner on Tim David
108.article_body: Opening batter David Warner said that the Singapore-born Tim David is a "godsend" for the Australian team. "He's an incredible player. Has some serious power, so it boosts our middle order," Warner said. The 35-year-old cricketer added, "You don't get these type of players every day. So it's going to be good for us moving forward."

109.title: Owaisi shares portrait of Tipu in Constitution, says 'Our founders knew more'
109.article_body: AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi on Sunday shared a picture of the Constitution of India with Tipu Sultan's portrait in it, saying the founders of the Republic of India knew "more than mercy-petition-writers and British slaves". "I seem to have triggered too many illiterate sanghi shakha-putras with my tweet on Tipu Sultan," Owaisi wrote on Twitter.

110.title: India, Taiwan should consider finalising FTA at the earliest: Taiwanese envoy
110.article_body: Taiwan's de-facto Ambassador Baushuan Ger said that India and Taiwan should finalise the proposed free trade agreement (FTA) as soon as possible to remove barriers for trade and investment. Ger said Taiwan is keen to share its expertise with India in sectors like semiconductors, 5G, information security and AI. He reaffirmed Taipei's focus on supporting the rules-based international order.

111.title: All schools in UP's Aligarh closed till October 12 due to heavy rains
111.article_body: The district administration in Uttar Pradesh's Aligarh on Sunday announced that all schools till Class 12 will be closed till October 12 due to heavy rains in the past 24 hours. All schools affiliated with AMU have been asked to comply with the order. Several areas of the district were waterlogged due to the heavy rains.

112.title: Earth caves in at construction site in TN, 2 workers buried alive
112.article_body: Two construction workers were buried alive and two others managed to escape after a portion of earth caved in on them while they were working at a building construction site in Tamil Nadu on Sunday. Nilgiris District Collector, who visited the spot with senior officials, has ordered an inquiry to ascertain whether the construction work was permitted.

113.title: Jaya says Amitabh became 'active parent' after Shweta's marriage
113.article_body: Jaya Bachchan, in an episode of the podcast 'What The Hell Navya', revealed that her actor-husband Amitabh Bachchan became an "active parent" after the marriage of their daughter Shweta Bachchan. "Till then I was doing it alone, everything," she added. Shweta got married to Nikhil Nanda in 1997. 'What The Hell Navya' is hosted by Jaya's granddaughter Navya Naveli Nanda.

114.title: SBI lines up NPAs over ₹746 crore for sale in October and November
114.article_body: The State Bank of India has put various non-performing assets (NPAs) up for sale in October and November, including the fraud account of Sintex-BAPL, to recover over ₹746 crore. NPAs will be offered to asset reconstruction companies/financial institutions, banks or Non-Banking Financial Companies. The auction will include accounts of Sintex-BAPL, Surat Hazira NH6 Tollway and Shreebhav Polyweaves.

115.title: IDBI Bank buyers need MHA clearance in 1st stage of bidding
115.article_body: The central government has mandated that interested buyers of IDBI Bank will have to seek security clearance from the Ministry of Home Affairs (MHA) during the first stage of the bidding process. The government and LIC will together divest a 60.72% stake in the lender. Interested parties will have to certify that no regulatory authority's investigation is pending against them.

116.title: Nitish's blind eye to corruption is shameful: Ravi Shankar Prasad
116.article_body: BJP leader Ravi Shankar Prasad said it was "shameful" and "unfortunate" how Bihar CM Nitish Kumar has "turned a blind eye to the issue of corruption". "Nitish Kumar should let the law take its course," said Prasad. He was speaking about Kumar's statement in support of RJD President Lalu Prasad Yadav, who is accused of an alleged railway land-for-job scam.

117.title: Shami will replace Bumrah in T20 WC squad: Parthiv Patel
117.article_body: Ex-cricketer Parthiv Patel said that pacer Mohammad Shami will most likely replace injured Jasprit Bumrah in the Indian squad for the upcoming T20 World Cup. "Hopefully, because we have 20 days to go and he (Shami) has almost recovered from COVID-19. Before WC, India will play two practice matches...So he will get match-time...I feel he is the frontrunner," Patel said.

118.title: It left a huge impact on me: Kichcha Sudeepa on 'Kantara'
118.article_body: Actor Kichcha Sudeepa took to social media and penned a note praising the Kannada film 'Kantara'. "We do witness films that are...fantastic. But rarely do we come across one that leaves us speechless. 'Kantara' is one such film that left a huge impact on me," he said. He also praised actor Rishab Shetty's performance in the film, calling it "fantabulous".

119.title: US' Fritz beats compatriot Tiafoe to clinch 3rd title of 2022 at Japan Open
119.article_body: American Taylor Fritz beat compatriot Frances Tiafoe 7-6(7-3), 7-6(7-2) in Japan Open Tennis Championships final to claim his third title of 2022 on Sunday. Fritz became the 10th different American singles champion at the ATP 500 event and the first since Pete Sampras in 1996. Fritz will make his Top 10 debut at number 8 in ATP rankings on Monday.

120.title: Presence of 8 leopards confirmed in Delhi's Asola Bhatti Sanctuary
120.article_body: A year-long study by Delhi's forest and wildlife department and Bombay Natural History Society has confirmed the presence of eight leopards in Delhi's Asola Bhatti Wildlife Sanctuary. The study used 42 infra-red stealth camera traps to detect presence of leopards and other mammals like striped hyena and jungle cat. Sanctuary's area bordering Chhattarpur and Neeli Jheel witnessed most sightings.

121.title: 'Vikram', 'Ponniyin...' sequels will be blockbusters in Hindi: Jayantilal
121.article_body: Producer Jayantilal Gada has predicted that 'Vikram 2' and 'Ponniyin Selvan: II' will be blockbusters in Hindi. "More and more people will watch both 'Vikram' and 'Ponniyin Selvan: I' on the OTT world until the sequel arrives," he added. "If Sita Ramam team decides to make a sequel, even that will be a success story in Hindi," he stated.

122.title: Bodies of 3 women found floating in dam in Uttar Pradesh's Jhansi
122.article_body: Bodies of three women were found floating in a dam in Uttar Pradesh's Jhansi, police said. It is likely that they were swept away from bordering Madhya Pradesh's Tikamgarh district, Jhansi SSP said, adding that the bodies have been sent for postmortem. Information about the first body was received from a UP Irrigation Department employee in Mauranipur late on Saturday.

123.title: Video shows Centaurus Mall in Pakistan's Islamabad on fire
123.article_body: A massive fire broke out on the third floor of the Centaurus Mall in Pakistan's capital Islamabad on Sunday. People inside the mall were safely evacuated, Islamabad Police said. Pakistan's PM Shehbaz Sharif tweeted, "It is very unfortunate that this incident happened...I pray that there is no loss of life. Condolences and sympathies for the financial losses of the victims."

124.title: Drop it further: Vij as Owaisi says Muslim population is on decline
124.article_body: After AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi said Muslim population is on the decline, Haryana Home Minister Anil Vij said, "If it's so, then that's a very good thing." "Drop it further and bring it to 'hum do humare do'," Vij added. Earlier, Owaisi had said, "Don't take tension...Muslim population is not rising...Do you know who's...using condoms the most? [Muslims] are doing."

125.title: BJP trying to insult me: Rajendra Pal after resigning as Delhi Minister
125.article_body: AAP leader Rajendra Pal Gautam, who resigned from the Delhi Cabinet amid controversy over his participation in a religious conversion event, said BJP has made it an issue. He added that BJP is trying to insult him and the Aam Aadmi Party. He was criticised after participating in the event where 10,000 people converted to Buddhism.

126.title: Farmers are beaten by police, unable to get manure: Kamal Nath
126.article_body: Congress leader Kamal Nath said that the farmers in Madhya Pradesh are unable to get manure and instead are getting beaten by the state police. "On one hand, the farmers' soybean crop has been spoiled by the rains and on the other hand, they are getting worried about the manure," the former Madhya Pradesh CM said.

127.title: Mismatch in DNA samples does not absolve an accused: Karnataka HC
127.article_body: Karnataka HC said even if DNA samples do not match, it wouldn't absolve an accused since the submission is collaborative evidence. The court then rejected the petition of a man accused of raping and impregnating a 12-year-old girl. The man had approached the court after a DNA test showed that his blood and that of the foetus did not match.

128.title: Wasim Jaffer criticises boundary rope placement in Australia-England T20I, shares pic
128.article_body: Wasim Jaffer took to Twitter to share a picture from first Australia-England T20I in Perth and criticised the boundary rope being brought in "significantly". He wrote, "I see the boundary rope brought in significantly in the Australia-England T20I. I hope that's not the case during the T20 World Cup. Big grounds, long boundaries is what makes cricket in Australia unique."

129.title: 7 booked for kidnapping Pune businessman, demanding ₹20 crore ransom
129.article_body: Police have booked seven persons, including gangster Gajanan Marne, for allegedly kidnapping and demanding ₹20 crore ransom from a businessman in Pune. The accused also threatened to kill the businessman if he fails to give the money, police said. However, the victim was rescued by the police after they laid a trap and arrested four of the accused persons.

130.title: Thane man kills friend after fight over ₹4.5 lakh, informs police
130.article_body: A man stabbed his friend to death in Maharashtra's Kalyan after the victim was allegedly reluctant to pay back the ₹4.5 lakh loan he took from the accused. The accused then reportedly called the police and informed them about the murder. The two were said to be inebriated when the discussion on paying back the money turned violent.

131.title: PM Modi declares Gujarat's Modhera as India's first 24x7 solar-powered village
131.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Sunday declared Modhera, a village in Gujarat's Mehsana district, as India's first 24x7 solar-powered village. PM Modi said people of Modhera need not pay for electricity anymore but can sell the electricity they generate themselves. He also inaugurated projects worth about ₹3,900 crore related to dairy, skill development and healthcare in the village.

132.title: Australia's Wade allegedly obstructs the field, Jos Buttler refuses to appeal; video viral
132.article_body: Australia wicketkeeper-batter Matthew Wade allegedly obstructed the field during the first T20I against England in Perth. A video has gone viral showing Wade pushing bowler Mark Wood away so that he doesn’t reach the ball for a catch while it was in the air. The umpires offered England captain Jos Buttler to appeal for the dismissal, but he refused.

133.title: FIR against Pak Navy jawans for attempting to kill Indian fishermen
133.article_body: Gujarat Police have registered an FIR against 20-25 Pakistani Navy personnel for allegedly kidnapping and attempting to kill seven Indian fishermen in the Arabian Sea. On October 6, uniformed Pakistani jawans reportedly kidnapped the fishermen after firing unprovoked on the boat fishing in Indian waters off the Jakhau coast. The fishermen were then rescued by the Indian Coast Guard.

134.title: It's overdue, frankly: iPod creator on EU forcing Apple for USB-C
134.article_body: Apple's iPod creator Tony Fadell has reacted to the EU's decision of having one single charger, USB-C, for all devices in 2023. "I'm not too worried about this regulation. They're simply forcing Apple to do the right thing...It's overdue, frankly," he tweeted. "They (Apple) have to put their responsibility for the planet over its shareholders," he said in another tweet.

135.title: Man fires outside Delhi store to extort ₹50 lakh from owner, video surfaces
135.article_body: A man opened fire outside a grocery store in Delhi's Dariyapur and attempted to extort ₹50 lakh from the owner, reports said. In a video of the incident, two people reached the store with their faces covered, following which one of the accused threw a note inside the shop and escaped on a bike with the other accused.

136.title: Nitish Kumar politically isolated, growing delusional: Prashant Kishor
136.article_body: Poll strategist Prashant Kishor claimed that Bihar CM Nitish Kumar was feeling "politically isolated, after being surrounded by people whom he did not trust". "Slowly, age seems to be catching up...and he seems to be growing delusional," said Kishor. Refuting Kumar's claims that he's working for the BJP, Kishor asked why then would he suggest moves to "strengthen the Congress".

137.title: Housing societies' representatives walk out of PCMC session
137.article_body: Housing societies' representatives walked out from a Pimpri Chinchwad Municipal Corporation (PCMC) session on wet waste disposal due to the absence of civic officials. The PCMC said that the officials reached late as they were attending a meeting with Leader of Opposition Ajit Pawar. "We walked out in protest against PCMC's non-serious approach to a serious issue," a representative said.

138.title: Congrats: Novak Djokovic to Rafael Nadal on the birth of his son
138.article_body: Congratulating 22-time Grand Slam champion Rafael Nadal on the birth of his son, world number seven Novak Djokovic said, "It's a beautiful news. I wish his wife and baby a lot of health and happiness." He added, "As a father, I'm not gonna give any advice to him. He has a big family. I'm sure he will experience himself."

139.title: 3 arrested for cheating family of ₹46 lakh insurance in Thane
139.article_body: A relationship manager in an insurance company and her two accomplices have been arrested from Ulhasnagar for cheating a family of their policy worth ₹46.61 lakh. In March 2020, the employee approached the insured and under the pretext of updating the KYC took copies of all relevant documents. Later, the accomplices changed the policy to their name.

140.title: 28-year-old priest caught wearing burqa in Kerala, says he has 'chicken pox'
140.article_body: A 28-year-old temple priest wearing a burqa and moving around suspiciously was caught by public and handed over to police in Kerala's Kozhikode. Jishnu Namboothiri said he was wearing burqa as he had chicken pox. Police said they couldn't find any traces of chicken pox on preliminary examination and he was let off after they verified his name and address.

141.title: Ektaa Kapoor told me to be a producer for Hansal Mehta's next: Kareena
141.article_body: Actress Kareena Kapoor Khan, who will feature in Hansal Mehta's next, has revealed that producer Ektaa Kapoor told her to make her debut as a producer for the untitled project. "I did it because I loved the script so much. I don't know if I'm going to start producing films because I don't know anything about it," Kareena added.

142.title: Several passengers injured as bus hits tempo after tyre burst in Pune
142.article_body: Several passengers were injured after a bus they were travelling in jumped a divider after suffering a tyre burst and hit a tempo in Pune district on Saturday. The accident occurred when the tempo was waiting in line to fill fuel at a gas station on the Mumbai-Bengaluru highway near Sarola village. Police said injured passengers are out of danger.

143.title: Delhi to host first 'slum festival' on World Homeless Day on Mon
143.article_body: Delhi government will be organising its first 'slum festival' on World Homeless Day on October 10, a statement issued by Delhi Urban Shelter Improvement Board said. The festival aimed towards "sensitising the public about homelessness" will be held at the night shelter complex at Sarai Kale Khan. Delhi's Deputy CM Manish Sisodia will be the chief guest at the event.

144.title: India-UK FTA talks face deadlock over data localisation: Report
144.article_body: India-UK free trade agreement (FTA) is facing a possible deadlock over issues like data localisation and UK firms being allowed to bid for Indian government contracts, according to reports. This comes after a UK government spokesperson said they "won't sacrifice quality over speed". "[We] will only sign when we have a deal that meets...UK's interests," the spokesperson had said.

145.title: Delhi minister Rajendra Pal Gautam resigns over presence at conversion event
145.article_body: Delhi minister Rajendra Pal Gautam has resigned from the Arvind Kejriwal cabinet on Sunday. This comes days after a video emerged of him at an event where 10,000 people converted to Buddhism. The BJP had criticised the event, where the crowd took BR Ambedkar's 22 vows and said they would not pray to Hindu gods and goddesses.

146.title: 3 arrested after attack that killed Israeli soldier in Jerusalem
146.article_body: Three Palestinians were arrested on Sunday for their suspected involvement in an attack on an Israeli military checkpoint on Saturday. An 18-year-old female soldier was killed and three others were injured after a Palestinian gunman opened fire at the checkpoint in east Jerusalem. A manhunt involving police and security officers, along with soldiers, was reportedly launched following the attack.

147.title: 5 electrocuted, 2 injured after Eid-e-Milad procession in UP's Bahraich
147.article_body: Five people, including four children, were killed and two others were injured after coming in contact with a high-tension wire after an Eid-e-Milad (Barawafat) procession in Uttar Pradesh's Bahraich district in the early hours of Sunday. The deceased children were aged between 10 and 17 years. CM Yogi Adityanath expressed his condolences to the families of the deceased.

148.title: 48-year-old actress Hilary Swank pregnant with twins, shares her pics
148.article_body: American actress Hilary Swank, who won the Best Actress Oscar for her film 'Boys Don't Cry', has revealed that she is pregnant with twins. "Coming soon…DOUBLE feature," the 48-year-old actress wrote on Instagram as she shared pictures of her baby bump. "This is something that I've been wanting for a long time," the actress said.

149.title: Javagal Srinath forgets handing coin to captain at toss ahead of India-SA ODI, video viral
149.article_body: A video went viral showing referee Javagal Srinath forgetting to hand coin to India captain Shikhar Dhawan at toss ahead of the second India-South Africa ODI. After introducing the captains and referee, commentator Sanjay Manjrekar asked who has got the coin. Dhawan and Keshav Maharaj looked at each other in confusion before realising Srinath's yet to hand Dhawan the coin.

150.title: Tokyo Olympian swimmer Srihari wins 6th gold at 36th National Games
150.article_body: Tokyo Olympian swimmer Srihari Nataraj won his sixth gold medal at 36th National Games after clinching the men's 100m freestyle gold on Saturday. Srihari, representing Karnataka, clocked 50.41s to set a new National Games record. This was Srihari's second gold in freestyle swimming events at the Games. He had earlier won two gold medals each in backstroke and relay events.

151.title: Centre, Delhi govt failed to safeguard lives during Delhi riots: Report
151.article_body: According to a report, the Centre and Delhi government "failed to fulfil their solemn obligation to safeguard lives, property and the rule of law" during the 2020 Delhi violence. It criticised the Ministry of Home Affairs, along with stating that the media played a "key role in propagating hateful narratives". The report was authored by a committee of former judges.

152.title: Ranbir Kapoor says he won't come on 'Koffee With Karan' ever: Johar
152.article_body: Filmmaker Karan Johar has said that Ranbir Kapoor teases him and says that he will not come on 'Koffee With Karan' ever. "I'll try and convince him for the next season," Johar added. The filmmaker stated, "I'm hoping...we can do something solid with Shah Rukh Khan in the next season because he's been such a huge part of the show."

153.title: Saif said 'You're a fresh air, performed very well': Yogita on 'Vikram...'
153.article_body: Actress Yogita Bihani, opening up about the best compliment she received for playing Chanda in 'Vikram Vedha', said, "Saif (Ali Khan) told me, 'You are a fresh air, it's a good casting and you have performed very well.'" "He also said, 'You brighten up the screen!'" she added. "That was the best compliment coming from him," Yogita said.

154.title: BJP's 'antim yatra' will begin when Cong's Bharat Jodo ends: Cong
154.article_body: When Congress' 'Bharat Jodo Yatra' concludes in Kashmir, BJP's "antim yatra" will begin, said Goa Congress President Amit Patkar on Saturday. He said that BJP's foundation was based on the "Fake in India" mission under "Jumla Raj" of PM Narendra Modi, whose MA in political science is a "mystery". Lakhs of people are joining Rahul Gandhi every day, he added.

155.title: Ratan Tata awarded 'Sewa Ratna' by RSS-affiliate Sewa Bharati
155.article_body: RSS-affiliated Sewa Bharati has awarded 'Sewa Ratna' to Ratan Tata for his philanthropic efforts. For their "priceless contribution in social work or providing funds for social development", 24 other dignitaries and social institutions were also awarded, Sewa Bharati said. Recently, Ratan Tata announced an investment in Goodfellows, a startup that offers companionship to senior citizens.

156.title: She'll do something incredible: Margot on Lady Gaga as Harley Quinn
156.article_body: Margot Robbie has reacted to Lady Gaga being cast as Harley Quinn in 'Joker: Folie à Deux', saying that "she'll do something incredible with it". Margot portrayed Harley Quinn in several films, including 'Suicide Squad' and 'Birds of Prey'. 'Joker: Folie à Deux', the second part of Todd Phillips' 'Joker', is expected to release on October 4, 2024.

157.title: 'Like 2 brothers': Kharge on contesting Cong Prez polls against Tharoor
157.article_body: Congress leader Mallikarjun Kharge on Sunday likened his battle for the Congress President's post against Shashi Tharoor "like two brothers at home". He said the contest between the two leaders was aimed at putting forth their viewpoints for the betterment of the country and the party. The contest is about what the two leaders can do together, Kharge added.

158.title: Mumbai Police registers FIR over 'fake' affidavits supporting Uddhav-led Sena
158.article_body: Mumbai Police has registered an FIR against unidentified persons on charges of cheating and forgery, after recovering over 4,500 affidavits to support Uddhav Thackeray-led Shiv Sena, an official said on Sunday. "It is my allegation that these false and fake affidavits of Shiv Sainiks had been prepared for filing before the EC," said Naresh Mhaske, spokesperson of Eknath Shinde-led Sena.

159.title: Armed criminals loot mobile shop of ₹1.5 cr in Delhi's Karol Bagh
159.article_body: A group of five-six armed criminals broke into a mobile accessories shop in Delhi's Karol Bagh and looted ₹1.5 crore at gunpoint, police said. Police said that the owner told them that a gang of criminals entered the shop posing as customers. The accused were wearing helmets to cover their faces and looted the store at gunpoint and escaped.

160.title: Tourist bus falls off hill in Andhra Pradesh, 10 passengers injured
160.article_body: At least 10 passengers were injured after a tourist bus fell off a hill in Andhra Pradesh's Alluri Sitharamaraju district on Sunday. The accident took place at Vanajangi when the bus was going from Visakhapatnam to Paderu. The injured persons were rescued by the locals and later taken to a hospital.

161.title: 57 students mysteriously poisoned in Mexico school, one critical
161.article_body: At least 57 students were poisoned by an unidentified substance in a secondary school in the Mexican state of Chiapas, according to local authorities. One student in a "delicate" condition was transferred to a hospital in the state's capital. The authorities conducted 15 toxicology exams and all of them came out negative for illicit drugs.

162.title: K'taka CM inaugurates 'Naga Mantapa' at Isha Yoga Centre in B'luru
162.article_body: Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai inaugurated the 'Naga Mantapa' at the Isha Yoga Centre in Bengaluru on Saturday. The 'Naga Mantapa' will be open to the public from October 10 (Monday). "Sadhguru is a global Guru from Karnataka," Bommai said. Over 5,000 residents from Chikkaballapura participated in the event.

163.title: 7 of top 10 most valued firms add ₹1 lakh cr to m-cap; RIL top gainer
163.article_body: Market capitalisation (m-cap) of seven of top 10 most valued firms rose to ₹1.01 lakh crore last week. Top gainer Reliance Industries Limited's m-cap rose by ₹37,581.61 crore to ₹16.46 lakh crore. It was followed by Tata Consultancy Services, whose m-cap rose by ₹22,082.37 crore to ₹11.21 lakh crore. Hindustan Unilever's m-cap dropped by ₹23,025.99 crore to ₹6.10 lakh crore.

164.title: Most artistes in music industry are valued after their death: Kavita Seth
164.article_body: Singer Kavita Seth expressed her disappointment that "most artistes in the music industry are valued only after they have left the world". Remembering KK, Kavita said after his demise, people remembered his work, but when he was alive, "the same people didn't care to give him the respect that he deserved". The singer said people should start valuing good artistes.

165.title: No one in the world can cope with the Haaland situation at the moment: Klopp
165.article_body: Praising Manchester City forward Erling Haaland, Liverpool manager Jürgen Klopp said, "Nobody in the world can cope with the Erling Haaland situation at the moment, it's crazy what he's doing." He added, "He's an exceptional player in an exceptional team." The 22-year-old, who joined Manchester City from Borussia Dortmund this season, has scored 15 goals in nine Premier League matches.

166.title: Didn't anyone from Jammu deserve to be J&K LG?: Mufti
166.article_body: PDP chief Mehbooba Mufti on Sunday said that the BJP could have made a Lieutenant Governor (LG) from Jammu but instead, they made the LG of J&K from Uttar Pradesh. Furthermore, she said, "Didn't anyone from Jammu deserve to be the LG?" "They…[told] people of Jammu that they’ll make a CM from Jammu," Mufti said.

167.title: People should learn compassion, dedication from Valmiki: Mohan Bhagwat
167.article_body: On the occasion of Valmiki Jayanti, RSS chief Mohan Bhagwat said that people should learn compassion, dedication and a sense of duty from Maharishi Valmiki. "I attended the inauguration of the first Valmiki temple in Nagpur. If Valmiki had not written the Ramayana, we would not have known about Lord Ram," said Bhagwat during his address to Valmiki Samaj.

168.title: Assam CM shares video of rhino hit by truck, says 'won’t allow infringement on their space'
168.article_body: Assam CM Himanta Biswa Sarma on Sunday shared a video wherein a rhinoceros got hit by a truck at Haldibari in Dhubri district. Sharing the video, he wrote, "Rhinos are our special friends; we'll not allow any infringement on their space... In this unfortunate incident...the rhino survived...To save animals at Kaziranga, we're working on a special 32-km elevated corridor."

169.title: Having Haaland helps Kevin De Bruyne a lot: City's Pep Guardiola
169.article_body: Manchester City manager Pep Guardiola has said having Erling Haaland in the team helps midfielder Kevin De Bruyne a lot in the games. "For Kevin...to have this threat, pace and movement in behind helps a lot," said Guardiola after 4-0 win over Southampton. Kevin has registered nine assists in as many EPL matches so far this season.

170.title: 52-yr-old man loses ₹1.50 lakh in debit card swap fraud in Chandigarh
170.article_body: Two unidentified men allegedly withdrew ₹1.50 lakh from a man’s bank account after swapping his debit card at an ATM in Chandigarh, police said. They offered help to 52-year-old victim as he was unable to withdraw cash. However, they also couldn't withdraw cash at that time. Later, victim realised his card was swapped and cash was withdrawn from his account.

171.title: PM Narendra Modi wishes everyone on Eid-e-Milad-un-Nabi
171.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi wished everyone on Eid-e-Milad-un-Nabi, which is the birth anniversary of Prophet Muhammad and is observed in the month of Rabi-ul-Awwal. "May this occasion further the spirit of peace, togetherness and compassion in our society. Eid Mubarak," PM Modi wrote on Twitter. Muslims celebrate the occasion by wearing new clothes, offering prayers and exchanging gifts.

172.title: 9-year-old thalassemia patient becomes doctor for a day in B'luru
172.article_body: Bengaluru's Narayana Health City said it helped Fathima AK, a nine-year-old thalassemia patient, realise her dream by letting her be a doctor for a day. She assisted doctors in the OPD and also went along with them to meet inpatients. "It was the best day of my life. It's exhilarating to know how their work impacts our life," Fathima said.

173.title: Over 200 whales die in mass stranding at NZ's Chatham Islands
173.article_body: Over 200 pilot whales have died after getting stranded on the shores of New Zealand's Chatham Islands, the country's Department of Conservation said on Saturday. The department added that some of the whales that survived were euthanised. The whales couldn't be refloated due to "the risks of a shark attack" on humans and the whales, according to conservation officers.

174.title: Airbus, Air France face trial over crash that claimed 228 lives
174.article_body: Aircraft manufacturer Airbus and French flag carrier Air France will go on trial on Monday over the crash of Flight 447 on June 1, 2009. The flight from Rio de Janeiro to Paris plunged into the Atlantic Ocean during a storm, killing 228 people on board.
