Airbus and Air France have been charged with involuntary manslaughter in the case.

175.title: New scam targets people with 'your electricity will be disconnected' texts
175.article_body: Scammers are targeting people by sending them texts on WhatsApp and via SMS claiming that their electricity connection will be disconnected unless they contact a certain number. "Your Electricity Power will disconnect at 9:30 pm as your last month's bill wasn't updated. Call us [mobile number]," a text read. The scammers could potentially defraud the recipients of their money.

176.title: Not even 1% of Adipurush is a deviation from Ramayan: Dialogue writer Manoj
176.article_body: 'Adipurush' dialogue writer Manoj Muntashir addressed the criticism that his film has been receiving and said that "not even 1% of [the] film is a deviation from actual Ramayan". "This is the story we've lived with, are retelling and showing," he added. Meanwhile, director Om Raut said, "This isn't a film for us...This is a representation of our devotion, faith."

177.title: I don't understand American terms like depression, I am a farmer: Kapil Dev
177.article_body: India's 1983 World Cup-winning captain Kapil Dev, in a recent event, said he doesn't understand "American terms" like depression and pressure. "I'm a farmer and we play because we enjoy the game...There can't be any pressure while enjoying the game," he said. "If cricketers are passionate, they shouldn't feel pressure. If they feel pressure, they shouldn't play," he added.

178.title: Had to do this: Prithviraj on producing Malayalam version of 'Kantara'
178.article_body: Actor-filmmaker Prithviraj Sukumaran, who called 'Kantara' a "glorious cinematic achievement", announced that he'd be producing the Malayalam version of the Rishab Shetty film. "I absolutely HAD to do this after watching the Kannada version," he said. Trade analyst Taran Adarsh also shared that the Hindi and Telugu versions of the Kannada film will release on October 14 and 15, respectively.

179.title: Pune Zilla Parishad to build memorial for staffers who died fighting COVID
179.article_body: The Pune Zilla Parishad is planning to build a memorial for 35 staffers who died during the pandemic while undertaking efforts to curb COVID-19. According to its Chief Executive Officer Ayush Prasad, these staffers were working either in hospitals or in "extension health services". "A committee has been formed to formalise the design," he added.

180.title: 6 people booked for abducting, assaulting man in Gurugram's Sohna
180.article_body: Six people were booked for allegedly abducting and assaulting a man in Silani village in Sohna, Gurugram. The incident happened after the victim, Ashok Kumar, opened fire using his revolver during an argument between him and his accused relatives, police said. The suspects will be soon arrested while Ashok was arrested and booked under the Arms Act, police added.

181.title: Gross direct tax collection jumps 24% YoY to ₹9 lakh cr in H1 FY23
181.article_body: Gross direct tax collection on corporate and individual earnings rose 23.8% YoY to ₹8.98 lakh crore between April 1 and October 8, 2022, the Central Board of Direct Taxes said. While gross collection of taxes on corporate earning rose 16.73% YoY, personal income tax collection jumped 32.30% YoY. In the same time period, refunds worth ₹1.52 lakh crore were issued.

182.title: I hope Ishan Kishan takes on more responsibility: Aakash Chopra
182.article_body: Cricketer-turned-commentator Aakash Chopra has said he wants India batter Ishan Kishan to take on more responsibility in the ongoing ODI series against South Africa. "You're getting the chances now, but once the T20 World Cup is done, the seniors will be available and they will play," explained Aakash. Ishan was dismissed after scoring 20(37) in the first SA ODI.

183.title: I've no idea what is fair: Medvedev on retiring vs Djokovic at Astana Open
183.article_body: Explaining the reason behind his retirement midway against Novak Djokovic in Astana Open semi-final, Daniil Medvedev said, "It's the second time in my life I retired like this with a pulled muscle." He added that playing another set would've resulted in missing half a year instead of a month and he doesn't have any idea about what is fair.

184.title: Rahul will be seen in new avatar after Bharat Jodo Yatra: Digvijaya
184.article_body: Congress leader Digvijaya Singh on Sunday said that Rahul Gandhi will be seen in a new avatar after the party's Bharat Jodo Yatra. Singh said that Gandhi has become a symbol of "Bharat Jodo", adding that people are very impressed that he's walking all the way during the yatra. Notably, Gandhi is spearheading the yatra that will end in J&K.

185.title: Be happy that people care: Ramiz Raja recalls advice to Babar over his criticism
185.article_body: Recalling a conversation with Pakistan captain Babar Azam about facing constant criticism, PCB chief Ramiz Raja said he has told Babar to take the feedback positively. "I say to Babar, 'Be happy that cricket isn't like any other sport in Pakistan where people don't care about them'," revealed Raja. "When people are engaged, they will form opinions," he added.

186.title: Swastika shares pic with WB CM, says 'Wished her Shubho Bijoya & got chocolates'
186.article_body: Actress Swastika Mukherjee met West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee at the Durga Puja Carnival on Red Road in Kolkata. The actress took to Twitter to share a picture where she was seen interacting with Banerjee. Swastika wrote, "Have always admired her indomitable spirit and fiery personality. Wished her Shubho Bijoya and got chocolates."

187.title: Pune hospital performs rare procedure on newborn with heart disease
187.article_body: A newborn with complex congenital heart disease underwent a rare hybrid procedure known as patent ductus arteriosus (PDA) stenting at Pune's Army Institute of Cardio-Thoracic Sciences. The baby had pulmonary atresia in which the pulmonary valve is absent. The team that performed the procedure included cardiologists, a cardio-thoracic surgeon and a cardiac anaesthetist.

188.title: Newborn girl found in garbage dump in Delhi's Vasant Kunj is stable: Police
188.article_body: Delhi Police on Sunday said that the newborn girl who was found in a garbage dump and admitted to a private hospital in Vasant Kunj is in stable condition. "The baby was drenched due to rain, extremely weak and in a hypothermic state with the umbilical cord attached," said Dr Rahul Nagpal, Director and HOD, Pediatrics, Fortis Hospital, Vasant Kunj.

189.title: Workers fall from scaffolding at Delhi airport; 2 dead, 6 injured
189.article_body: Two labourers died and six others were injured after they fell from the scaffolding at a construction site in Terminal 1 of Delhi's Indira Gandhi International (IGI) Airport. While one worker was declared brought dead, the other died during treatment, DCP (IGI Airport) Tanu Sharma said. Sharma added that a case has been filed against the contractor in the matter.

190.title: Uddhav submits 'Rising Sun & Trishul' as alternatives after EC freezes Sena symbol
190.article_body: A day after the EC froze the name and symbol of Shiv Sena, Uddhav Thackeray submitted a list of three names and symbols, reports said. The Uddhav-led faction chose 'Shiv Sena Balasaheb Thackeray', 'Shiv Sena Uddhav Balasaheb Thackeray' and 'Shiv Sena Prabodhankar Thackeray' as party names while choosing 'Trishul', a 'Mashal' and 'Rising Sun' as symbols.

191.title: Miss your noise, it's too quiet: Neetu on late husband Rishi Kapoor
191.article_body: Actress Neetu Kapoor took to Instagram and shared a picture of her late husband, actor Rishi Kapoor. Along with the picture, Neetu wrote, "Miss your noise, it's too quiet." Several celebrities, including Anushka Sharma and Maniesh Paul, reacted to the post. The veteran actor passed away on April 30, 2020, at 67.

192.title: Tipu was barbarian: Malviya on Owaisi's remark over renaming of Tipu Express
192.article_body: BJP's Amit Malviya reacted to AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi’s remark over renaming of Tipu Express. "BJP will never be able to erase Tipu's legacy," Owaisi had said. Following his reaction, Malviya tweeted, "BJP doesn't want to erase the legacy of Tipu. On the contrary, we want his true legacy to be known to the people. Tipu was a barbarian."

193.title: Rahul Gandhi should think before speaking against Savarkar: Shiv Sena
193.article_body: Shiv Sena leader Manisha Kayande condemned Congress MP Rahul Gandhi's remark against VD Savarkar and asked him to think before making such statements. "We prohibit Rahul Gandhi's statement and the Shiv Sena's opinion towards Savarkar is the same and it will never change," said Manisha. Earlier, Rahul had claimed that Savarkar used to work for the Britishers.

194.title: Hurricane Julia makes landfall in Nicaragua; 6,000 evacuated
194.article_body: Hurricane Julia made landfall in Nicaragua early Sunday, hours after lashing Colombia's San Andres island in a close pass-by. Nearly 6,000 people were moved to safer locations by Nicaraguan authorities ahead of Julia's arrival. Julia started off as a tropical storm on Saturday but developed into a Category 1 hurricane shortly before passing through the close vicinity of San Andres.

195.title: MK Stalin elected unopposed as DMK President for second time
195.article_body: Tamil Nadu Chief Minister MK Stalin was unanimously elected as DMK President at the party's general council meeting held in Chennai on Sunday. Party leaders Durai Murugan and TR Baalu were unanimously elected as General Secretary and Treasurer, respectively, with all three leaders being elected to their posts for the second time.

196.title: Google shutting down its Assistant Driving Mode on Nov 21: Report
196.article_body: Google is shutting down its Maps integration in Assistant Driving Mode Dashboard on November 21, according to a 9to5Google report. The Dashboard features media suggestions and quick access to audio controls, along with shortcuts for calling and texting. The car-optimised experience in Google Maps for Android, which Google also refers to as Driving Mode, will remain, the report said.

197.title: Boy rapes 4-yr-old neighbour after offering her candies in Gurugram
197.article_body: A 15-year-old boy allegedly raped his four-year-old neighbour after offering her candies in Gurugram on Tuesday evening. The victim was alone at her home when the boy allegedly raped her and urinated on her. The girl is being treated at a hospital for a stomach infection, while the boy has been apprehended and sent to a correctional home in Faridabad.

198.title: Delhi sees 2nd highest rainfall since 2007, temp margin drops to record low: IMD
198.article_body: The national capital received the second highest rainfall since 2007 in the last 24 hours till 8.30 am, the India Meteorological Department (IMD) said on Sunday. Due to continuous rainfall, the difference between minimum temperature (20.8 degrees Celsius) on Friday and maximum temperature (23.4 degrees Celsius) on Saturday was 2.6 degrees Celsius - the lowest since 1969, IMD officials said.

199.title: Eng destroyed us in T20 WC 2021, it was a turning point for Aus: Wade
199.article_body: Discussing Australia's defeat against England in T20 World Cup 2021 where England chased down a target of 126 in 11.4 overs, wicketkeeper Matthew Wade said, "They destroyed us." "It was...a turning point for the way we...[play] T20s," added Wade. "We've got seven batters...We've got...power and...depth [in] batting that...you need to go with [while facing] a team like England," he stated.

200.title: Assange's supporters form human chain in UK over extradition
200.article_body: Supporters of WikiLeaks Founder Julian Assange formed a human chain outside the UK Parliament after the government approved his extradition to the US to face criminal charges. Assange's wife Stella said that the extradition is a "stain" on the UK and US President Joe Biden-led administration. Pictures and a video of the human chain have surfaced online.

201.title: Never seen a liar like Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal: BJP's CR Paatil
201.article_body: Gujarat BJP chief CR Paatil criticised Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal for his "Kansa" remark and called him a liar. He also asked him to think before making such statements. "We have never seen a liar like Arvind Kejriwal. Despite being a CM, he peddles lies. He called people of Gujarat 'Kansa' & then he's seeking votes from them," said Paatil.

202.title: Ex-senator briefly held hostage during breakout bid in Philippines
202.article_body: An undertrial Philippine politician, Leila de Lima, was briefly held hostage during an attempted prison break in the Manila capital region, police said on Sunday. De Lima, a former senator, emerged unhurt from the incident, as per authorities. The three prisoners who staged the failed breakout were shot dead by police. One police officer was stabbed by the inmates.

203.title: Neetu Kapoor shares Ranbir's pics from 'Brahmastra' look test showing his 6-pack abs
203.article_body: Actress Neetu Kapoor took to Instagram Stories to share pictures of her son Ranbir Kapoor from 'Brahmastra' look test showing his six-pack abs. The pictures were originally shared by Ranbir's trainer and lifestyle coach Kunal Gir. "This one is for all Ranbir Kapoor fans. These are unseen pics taken during a look test in Bulgaria," he wrote in the caption.

204.title: Domino's responds after man shared pics of glass shards in pizza, says 'No anomaly found'
204.article_body: After a man in Mumbai shared pictures of glass shards that he allegedly found in his Domino's pizza, the company said that they will collect samples from the customer. Domino's said, "We immediately contacted the customer...Our quality team has also conducted a thorough investigation...and no anomaly was found...We follow a strict no-glass policy in our kitchen and operation area."

205.title: RSS chief's call to end caste system must be implemented: Pawar
205.article_body: NCP chief Sharad Pawar threw his weight behind RSS chief Mohan Bhagwat's call to end the age-old caste system that leads to discrimination within society. "The concept of untouchability was never part of religious text or practice," Bhagwat said, adding that the concepts of 'varna' and 'jati' had no place for discrimination, even in the past.

206.title: B'luru techie makes hoax bomb threats to Vidhana Soudha; arrested
206.article_body: A 41-year-old unemployed software engineer was arrested on Friday for making three hoax bomb calls to Karnataka Chief Secretary's office in Bengaluru's Vidhana Soudha. Police used sniffer dogs to search the Chief Secretary's office after Prashanth Kumar called at 2:06 pm on Friday and claimed he'd planted bombs. Kumar was arrested hours later from his home in Bengaluru's Hebbagodi.

207.title: England record highest-ever T20I total by a visiting team in Australia
207.article_body: England on Sunday recorded the highest-ever T20I total by a visiting team in Australia. England registered 208/6 in the first T20I in Perth to set the record. The previous record was jointly held by India and England, who had recorded 200/3 and 200/9 in Sydney and Hobart in 2016 and 2014, respectively. Alex Hales top-scored for England today with 84(51).

208.title: 'Ponniyin Selvan: Part Two' to release in Summer 2023: Report
208.article_body: Trade analyst Taran Adarsh shared that the makers of 'Ponniyin Selvan: Part Two' are "targeting a Summer 2023 release". He further informed that unlike 'Baahubali 2' and 'KGF 2', the sequel of the Mani Ratnam directorial was shot simultaneously with the first part. Recently, the makers announced that 'Ponniyin Selvan: Part One' crossed ₹300 crore worldwide at the box office.

209.title: 'Defectors platter' belongs to Shinde faction for serving BJP: Sibal
209.article_body: While reacting to the EC's decision to freeze the 'bow and arrow' symbol of the Shiv Sena, Congress leader Kapil Sibal said that the 'defectors platter' belongs to Eknath Shinde's faction for serving the BJP. EC freezing the Shiv Sena symbol amounts to "freezing democracy", he said, adding that the symbol belongs to the faction led by Uddhav Thackeray.

210.title: 4.4kg gold hidden in clothes, bags & hairband seized at Hyd airport
210.article_body: Customs officials have seized about 4.4 kg gold in separate incidents at Hyderabad airport. In first incident, three passengers tried to smuggle gold by concealing it in undergarments and chains. Two passengers who hid gold in their check-in baggage were intercepted in the second incident, while in the last incident, a passenger concealed gold in a hairband and dress parts.

211.title: Zomato CEO delivers orders once in 3 months, nobody recognised him: Investor
211.article_body: Zomato's Founder and CEO Deepinder Goyal wears a red t-shirt and spends a day delivering orders himself at least once a quarter on a motorcycle, Naukri.com owner and Zomato's early investor Sanjeev Bikhchandani has revealed. "Deepinder tells me that thus far nobody has recognised him," Bikhchandani added. Not only Goyal but all senior managers at Zomato do the same.

212.title: Mulayam Singh Yadav quite critical, on life-saving drugs: Medanta Hospital
212.article_body: Gurugram’s Medanta Hospital on Sunday said former UP CM Mulayam Singh Yadav’s condition is quite critical today and he is on life-saving drugs. "He is being treated in the ICU of the hospital by a comprehensive team of specialists," Dr Sanjeev Gupta, Medical Director, Medanta Hospital, Gurugram, said. He has been undergoing treatment at the hospital since August 22.

213.title: Muslims using condoms most: Owaisi on RSS chief's 'population' remark
213.article_body: Following RSS chief Mohan Bhagwat's 'population imbalance' remark, AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi said, "Don't take tension. Muslim population is not rising. In fact, it's on the decline." "Do you know who is...using condoms the most? [Muslims] are doing," Owaisi added. Notably, Bhagwat had called for a population control policy, saying that religion-based population imbalance couldn't be ignored.

214.title: Part of road collapses near under-construction building in Greater Noida
214.article_body: A portion of a road near an under-construction building in Greater Noida caved in on Sunday after incessant rain lashed parts of NCR for past two days. No injuries have been reported after the collapse. A video of the collapse showed a cave-in a few metres long. Three bulldozers and five dumpers have been deployed to fill the caved-in section.

215.title: Man snatches phone from woman travelling on scooty in Gurugram
215.article_body: A man allegedly snatched a woman's mobile phone while she was riding pillion on a scooty in  Gurugram. The suspect approached the woman, Bhawna Sharma, and fled after snatching her iPhone from her hands when the latter was returning home in Sushant Lok Phase-I from Ambience Mall, police said. Notably, an FIR was registered at DLF Phase-III Police Station.

216.title: What about Amitabh, Madhuri?: BJP on Pawar's Muslim-Bollywood remark
216.article_body: Responding to NCP chief Sharad Pawar's remark that Muslim minorities have made the biggest contribution to Bollywood, BJP asked whether Pawar can deny contributions made by Amitabh Bachchan and Madhuri Dixit. "So terrorists have no religion, but art and cinema have a religion, Pawar saheb?" the BJP spokesperson Shehzad Poonawalla asked.

217.title: Shah Rukh Khan, Deepika Padukone's 'Pathaan' to get a sequel: Reports
217.article_body: The makers of 'Pathaan' are reportedly working on a sequel to the film. "The team of Pathaan has begun writing...sequel to the film," a source was quoted as saying. The upcoming action film, starring Shah Rukh Khan, Deepika Padukone and John Abraham, is set to release in theatres on January 25, 2023. It is directed by Siddharth Anand.

218.title: Mumbai Police releases traffic advisory for Eid-e-Milad-un-Nabi processions
218.article_body: The Mumbai Traffic Police have made arrangements to ensure smooth commute amid Eid-e-Milad-un-Nabi processions, which will be taken out in parts of the city today. As per the advisory, traffic restrictions are imposed on certain areas like Byculla, Pydhonie, Dongri, Azad Maidan, among others. The restrictions on travel would be effective from 2 pm to the time the processions conclude.

219.title: Thanks for being the wind beneath my wings: Pujara to wife on her b'day
219.article_body: Team India batter Cheteshwar Pujara took to Twitter to wish his wife Puja on her birthday, terming her as the "wind beneath" his wings. "You don't just make me happy, you make me proud. My affection towards you grows with each passing year," added Pujara in his tweet. "Thank you for being you!" stated Pujara in his tweet.

220.title: Karnataka to witness heavy rainfall till October 11: IMD
220.article_body: The India Meteorological Department (IMD) has predicted rainfall across Karnataka till October 11. The forecast says that heavy and thunderous rainfall is expected in coastal Karnataka, north interior and south interior districts of the state. A yellow alert has also been issued for several north Karnataka districts, including Belagavi and Raichur.

221.title: Man arrested in B'luru for drug peddling, over 300 bottles of cough syrup seized
221.article_body: The Bengaluru Police arrested a man for allegedly peddling the Alluring Narcotic drug ESKUF (cough syrup) and seized 356 bottles of the cough syrup and a two-wheeler from the accused. The ESKUF cough syrup can only be sold with a proper medical prescription. The drug is reportedly known to be misused by mixing it with banned narcotic substances.

222.title: PM Narendra Modi wishes people on Valmiki Jayanti
222.article_body: PM Modi extended greetings on Valmiki Jayanti and also shared a video. The day marks the birth anniversary of Maharishi Valmiki who is credited with writing the original Ramayana. The UP government has decided to celebrate his anniversary in a grand manner across the state, including the continuous recital of the Ramayana at all temples of Lord Ram and Hanuman.

223.title: PM Modi responds to man's 'must visit Kashmir' tweet, shares pic of his visit to Srinagar
223.article_body: PM Narendra Modi recently responded to a tweet of a man who shared pictures from his recent trip to Kashmir and urged that people 'must visit'. Sharing a picture from his visit to the valley, PM Modi wrote, "Excellent. I'm also tempted to share a picture from my visit to Srinagar in 2019."

224.title: Amit Shah offers prayers at Kamakhya temple in Guwahati
224.article_body: Union Home Minister Amit Shah offered prayers at the Kamakhya temple in Assam's Guwahati on Sunday during his three-day visit to the Northeast. He was accompanied by Assam CM Himanta Biswa Sarma. "Feeling extremely blessed after praying at the Maa Kamakhya Devi Temple in Guwahati," Shah tweeted. CM Sarma tweeted a video of Union Home Minister’s visit to the temple.

225.title: Businesses can remain open 24×7 in Delhi, over 300 applications cleared: Report
225.article_body: Businesses like restaurants, transport services, BPOs and online delivery services which apply for exemptions will be allowed to operate 24×7 in Delhi starting next week, an official told The Indian Express. Lieutenant Governor VK Saxena recently approved the proposal to exempt 314 such places to operate all day long, some of them pending since 2016, the official added.

226.title: I don't think about it: Rizwan on contest with Surya for no.1 T20I batter's spot
226.article_body: Pakistan opener Muhammad Rizwan, on being asked about competition with India batter Suryakumar Yadav for the top spot in the ICC T20I batters' rankings, said, "I don't think much about it." He added, "Suryakumar is a good player and the way he plays I really enjoy it." Rizwan is currently the top-ranked batter in T20Is, while Suryakumar is placed second.

227.title: WhatsApp's clone app may be spying on Indian users: Report
227.article_body: 'GB WhatsApp', a clone of the Meta-owned messaging app WhatsApp, may be spying on Indian users and reading their chats, according to a report by ESET, the maker of NOD32 antivirus. The cloned third-party version of WhatsApp isn't available on Google Play. Hence, the versions of the clone app available on various download websites are riddled with malware, ESET added.

228.title: Boat capsizes in Nigeria amid heavy flooding; 10 dead, 60 missing
228.article_body: At least 10 people have died and 60 others are missing after a boat capsized in Nigeria's Anambra state amid heavy flooding, officials said on Saturday. The country's National Emergency Management Agency zonal coordinator said that around 85 people were on board the boat. At least 15 people have been rescued, Anambra's emergency management agency head said.

229.title: UK's trade minister fired after being seen touching a young man's thigh in a bar
229.article_body: UK's trade minister Conor Burns was removed from his position after he was allegedly seen touching a young man's thigh in a bar at the Tory Party conference. While he was asked to leave the government "with immediate effect", Burns has denied any wrongdoing. Notably, Burns was a long-time ally of former Prime Minister Boris Johnson.

230.title: Raavan looks like Khilji in 'Adipurush', are you making fun?: Mukesh
230.article_body: 'Shaktimaan' actor Mukesh Khanna said Saif Ali Khan's Raavan in 'Adipurush' looks like a Khilji ruler. He added, "[Saif] has been given a Mughal look. Are you making fun?" Mukesh further "warned" the "intellectual and rich people" to not use their money to change "rituals, religion and epic". Saif's look was trolled on Twitter after the 'Adipurush' teaser was released.

231.title: Govt starts probe as US fines Oracle over ₹3.3 cr bribe to railway officials: Report
231.article_body: The Ministry of Railways has reportedly initiated a probe against Oracle after the US SEC fined the company for paying about $400,000 (₹3.3 crore) in bribes to railway officials in 2019. "Oracle India sales employees...used an excessive discount scheme in connection with a transaction with a transportation company, a majority of which was owned by the Indian...Railways," the SEC said.

232.title: My best wishes for this endeavour: PM Modi on Puneeth's 'Gandhada Gudi'
232.article_body: PM Narendra Modi sent his best wishes for late actor Puneeth Rajkumar's upcoming film 'GG - Gandhada Gudi', which he called "a tribute to Mother Nature". Puneeth's wife Ashwini tweeted that the actor "cherished" his interactions with Modi. In response, Modi wrote that Puneeth "lives in the hearts of millions around the world" and was "blessed with unparalleled talent".

233.title: Tharoor’s appeal goes beyond party, Cong needs urgent reformist thinking: Karti
233.article_body: Congress MP Karti Chidambaram backed the party’s Presidential poll candidate Shashi Tharoor, saying the latter’s pragmatic modernism coupled with his appeal beyond the party, is crucial to fight BJP’s divisive politics. "Status quo and business as usual won’t help our party. There’s an urgent need for reformist thinking in our party," Karti Chidambaram added.

234.title: Sonali's family receives 2 letters alleging ₹10-cr deal in murder case, naming politicians
234.article_body: Sonali Phogat's family members have said that they received two letters from an anonymous sender, with her brother-in-law Aman Poonia stating that both the letters should be investigated. The first letter, which was received a month ago, has alleged that a deal of ₹10 crore was made in the murder case. Meanwhile, the other letter mentioned names of political leaders.

235.title: Max Verstappen wins F1 world championship for 2nd year in a row
235.article_body: Red Bull's 25-year-old Dutch driver Max Verstappen on Sunday won the Japanese Grand Prix to clinch Formula One 2022 world championship with four races left in the season. Verstappen has now won the world championship for the second year in a row. Verstappen is leading the 2022 driver standings with 366 points, followed by his teammate Sergio Perez (253 points).

236.title: NATO should do more to protect itself from Russia: German minister
236.article_body: German Defence Minister Christine Lambrecht said on Saturday that North Atlantic Treaty Organization (NATO) should "do more" to protect itself from Russia, adding that no one knows "how far Putin's delusions of grandeur can go". Lambrecht made the remarks during a visit to Lithuania. She further said that Russia's threat of nuclear weapons shows that its authorities have "no scruples".

237.title: Delhi Police releases list of roads to avoid due to waterlogging
237.article_body: The national capital witnessed waterlogging in several areas due to continuous rainfall causing traffic congestion. The Delhi Traffic Police on Sunday issued an advisory asking commuters to "plan their journey accordingly". The police asked commuters to avoid Ashoka Road near New PHQ, Rohtak Road near Peeragarhi Chowk, Mathura Road near Lodhi Colony flyover foot and Lajpat Nagar metro station.

238.title: I'm upset with Haaland, jokes Guardiola after 4-0 win vs Southampton
238.article_body: After their 4-0 win over Southampton, Manchester City manager Pep Guardiola jokingly said he was upset with striker Erling Haaland because he only scored once in the game. "The expectation is so high that everyone thinks that in every game he should score three or four goals," added Guardiola. Haaland has scored 15 goals in nine games in the EPL.

239.title: B'luru man who killed his grandmother over 'gobi manchurian' arrested
239.article_body: The Bengaluru Police arrested 27-year-old man who allegedly killed his grandmother over argument on a packet of gobi manchurian and buried her body inside the house with help of his mother. The police solved the murder case five years after the incident happened in 2016. The accused along with his mother vacated the house in 2017 and fled to Maharashtra.

240.title: Ranveer makes 7-foot-1-inch tall NBA legend O'Neal dance on 'Khalibali', video viral
240.article_body: Actor Ranveer Singh took to Instagram to share a video of himself making 7-foot-1-inch tall NBA legend Shaquille O'Neal dance on 'Khalibali'. "Big Man x Bad Man! The collab you didn’t know you needed! Here’s Shaq doing Khalibali! Yes. You read that right! Shaq-a-bibi!" Ranveer wrote. Actor Varun Dhawan commented, "The shaq attack."

241.title: Surprised, he looked fine: Djokovic on Medvedev retiring mid-match
241.article_body: Novak Djokovic said he was "surprised" to see Daniil Medvedev retire midway through their semi-final in the Astana Open 2022. "He looked completely fine...It is a shock," added Djokovic. "It was such a close match, particularly in the second set," he stated. "I am just sad for the tournament and for these people who were enjoying the battle," said Djokovic.

242.title: Meta's metaverse app facing quality issues, staff not using it enough: Exec in memo
242.article_body: Meta's flagship metaverse app, Horizon Worlds, is suffering from too many quality issues, according to an internal memo. In the memo, Meta's VP of Metaverse Vishal Shah, said the employees within the team aren't spending much time on Horizon. "Why don't we love the product we've built...If we don't love it, how can we expect...users to love it?" he added.

243.title: Legs of 100-year-old woman chopped off by robbers to steal her anklets in Jaipur
243.article_body: Police in Rajasthan's Jaipur have said that unidentified miscreants chopped off a 100-year-old woman's legs to steal her anklets. "She was lying severely injured near her house. Her neck had injuries too," police said. "My daughter called and told me about my mother lying injured...She was immediately rushed to the hospital," the victim's daughter said.

244.title: India announce their playing XI for 2nd ODI against South Africa, make 2 changes
244.article_body: South Africa stand-in captain Keshav Maharaj won the toss and elected to bat first in the second ODI against India in Ranchi. India have made two changes to their playing XI with Shahbaz Ahmed and Washington Sundar replacing Ravi Bishnoi and Ruturaj Gaikwad. Notably, Shahbaz is making his ODI debut for India today.

245.title: 17 killed in rocket attack in Ukraine's Zaporizhzhia: Official
245.article_body: At least 17 people were killed after buildings in Ukraine's Zaporizhzhia were hit by rockets in an overnight attack by Russia, an official of the city council said on Sunday. The official added that about five private houses were destroyed and around 40 were damaged in the attack. The region's governor said, "There may be more people under the rubble."

246.title: 'Goodbye' tickets to be sold for ₹80 on Amitabh Bachchan's b'day: Report
246.article_body: To mark Amitabh Bachchan's 80th birthday, the makers of 'Goodbye' have decided to sell the film's tickets for ₹80 on October 11. "The makers plan to promote this exciting offer and are confident that it'll result in huge footfalls," a source told Bollywood Hungama. The Vikas Bahl directorial, which released on October 7, features Amitabh with Rashmika Mandanna.

247.title: Shahbaz Ahmed should replace Gaikwad or Kishan in the 2nd ODI: Jaffer
247.article_body: Ex-India opener Wasim Jaffer said all-rounder Shahbaz Ahmed should replace either Ruturaj Gaikwad or Ishan Kishan in Team India's lineup for the second ODI against South Africa. "Shahbaz...would be helpful in the bowling department and strengthen the batting...You cannot go ahead with...five bowling options in ODI cricket," added Jaffer. South Africa beat India by nine runs in the first ODI.

248.title: Twitter offered billions off the $44-billion deal to Elon, he refused: Musk's lawyer
248.article_body: Twitter offered "billions off the transaction price" to Elon Musk, an attorney for the world's richest person claimed. "Musk refused (the offer) because Twitter attempted to put certain self-serving conditions on the deal," Alex Spiro said. Musk has revived the $44-billion deal to take Twitter private at the original price of $54.20 per share, days before a trial in court.

249.title: Pralhad Joshi requests Gujarat CM to give space for Karnataka Bhavan
249.article_body: Union Minister Pralhad Joshi made an appeal to Gujarat Chief Minister Bhupendra Patel to allow space for the construction of Karnataka Bhavan in the state. He told Gujarat CM that he would personally cooperate with the Karnataka government for the construction of the bhavan. He made the appeal during the 75th anniversary of the Kannada Sangha in Ahmedabad, Gujarat.

250.title: Age showing its effect on Nitish ji: Prashant Kishor
250.article_body: Poll strategist Prashant Kishor criticised Nitish Kumar for alleging that he is working for BJP and said, "Age showing its effect on Nitish ji." "He wants to say something but he speaks something else. If I was working on BJP's agenda, why would I speak of strengthening Congress?" Kishor added. "He's surrounded by those whom he can't trust," he said.

251.title: Protest staged after Hyd police shut petrol pumps over Eid-e-Milad
251.article_body: People staged a protest on Saturday night in Hyderabad's Chaderghat after the police shut down petrol pumps in view of Eid-e-Milad-un-Nabi. The protesters demanded that the petrol pumps should be opened, with one motorist saying that the police shouldn't shut pumps without prior notice. The police arrived at the scene and dispersed the public using mild force.

252.title: Time has come for 'Bahujan Samaj' to become 'ruler society': Mayawati
252.article_body: On the death anniversary of party founder Kanshiram, BSP Chief Mayawati said that the time has come for the "Bahujan Samaj" to become the "Hukmran Samaj" (ruler society). "Bahujan Samaj has got tired of demanding its constitutional and legal rights," tweeted Mayawati. "This is today's message and this work has to be done with determination," she added.

253.title: BJP won't be able to erase Tipu’s legacy: Owaisi on renaming of Tipu Express
253.article_body: AIMIM MP Asaduddin Owaisi on Sunday criticised the BJP government after the Railway Board changed name of the train connecting Bengaluru and Mysuru from Tipu Express to Wodeyar Express. "Tipu irks BJP because he waged three wars against its British masters…BJP will never be able to erase Tipu’s legacy," Owaisi added. "Another train could've been named after Wodeyars," Owaisi stated.

254.title: KTR represents a failed government that cheated Telangana: BJP
254.article_body: BJP leader Ponguleti Sudhakar Reddy criticised Telangana minister KTR for his remarks against RSS, claiming that the minister represents a failed government that cheated the citizens. "I strongly condemn the irrelevant remarks made by KTR. It is baseless. The BJP demands that he withdraws it," said Reddy. KTR had previously asked RSS chief to refrain from loose talk.

255.title: Video shows electric poles installed in middle of a Pak road, Twitter users react
255.article_body: A Twitter user shared a video wherein electricity poles were installed in the middle of a road in Pakistan. The video, shot by the commuter from inside a vehicle, showed the poles not aligned in a single line, making them dangerous for travellers. A Twitter user commented, "A great example of incompetence," while some others tagged the state government.

256.title: Manoj Bajpayee to star in a courtroom drama, says it'll 'intrigue' audience
256.article_body: Actor Manoj Bajpayee will be part of an untitled courtroom drama. Talking about the project, Bajpayee said he was "fascinated" by the script and added that it will "intrigue the audience". Stating that he "immediately agreed to be a part" of the film, the actor said it's a project that "people will remember for a really long time".

257.title: I had butterflies: Suryakumar on 1st practice session in Australia
257.article_body: India batter Suryakumar Yadav, in a video released by BCCI, said he had butterflies during his first practice session in Australia ahead of the upcoming T20 World Cup. "I was looking forward to coming here and attending the first practice session...Just wanted to feel how the pace of the wicket is, how the bounce is," Suryakumar said in the video.

258.title: Rajasthan Congress MLA & former minister Bhanwar Lal Sharma passes away at 77
258.article_body: Rajasthan Congress MLA and former minister Bhanwar Lal Sharma passed away at the age of 77 in Jaipur on Sunday. State CM Ashok Gehlot expressed his condolences, saying that Sharma was "unwell for a long time" and that he was in touch with Sharma's family and met them at hospital last night. Sharma was a seven-term MLA from Sardarshahar (Churu).

259.title: Pune couple booked for forging documents to get ₹50 lakh insurance claim
259.article_body: A couple in Pune has been booked for trying to cheat an insurance company. The accused man had invested in a life insurance policy for ₹25 lakh and an accident insurance term plan of ₹25 lakh in January and made his wife the nominee. In March, his wife presented fake documents, death certificate to the insurance company to extract money.

260.title: Such 'drama' will carry on till 2024 polls: Tejashwi on chargesheet against Lalu
260.article_body: After CBI filed a chargesheet against his father and RJD chief Lalu Prasad Yadav in the land-for-job scam, Bihar Deputy CM Tejashwi Yadav said constitutional institutions are being constantly "misused" and that such "drama" will carry on till the 2024 polls. "In this case, only CBI is there...ED will also come, it will investigate and file a chargesheet," Tejashwi added.

261.title: Anna Sorokin, who posed as fake heiress with $67 mn fortune, released from US jail
261.article_body: Anna Sorokin, convicted of scamming $275,000 from banks, hotels and wealthy elites by pretending to be a German heiress, has been released from an immigration detention centre in New York. Sorokin will remain in 24-hour home confinement and is barred from using social media. Sorokin posed as Anna Delvey and lied about having a $67 million fortune to scam others.

262.title: Traffic diversions issued in Hyd in view of Eid-e-Milad processions
262.article_body: In view of Eid-e-Milad-un-Nabi processions to be taken out on Sunday, the Hyderabad Traffic Police issued a traffic advisory. The traffic diversions/restrictions will be in place from 8 am to 6 pm today. All flyovers, except the Begumpet flyover, Lunger House flyover, Dabeerpura flyover, Lalapet flyover and PVNR Expressway, will be closed during this period.

263.title: Father chains UP woman in room for 36 yrs; family threw water from window to bathe her
263.article_body: A 53-year-old woman in Uttar Pradesh's Firozabad has been freed 36 years after she was chained inside a room by her father. Her family slipped meals from beneath the door and threw water at her from the window for her to bathe. An NGO that helped in her rescue said the woman was found in very poor condition.

264.title: Jackky and I don't talk about work, it's a conscious choice: Rakul
264.article_body: Actress Rakul Preet Singh said she doesn't discuss work with her boyfriend Jackky Bhagnani. "We don't really talk about work and it is a conscious choice as it can get quite complicated," she said, adding that she seeks his opinion whenever she feels stuck. She added that the actor-producer "loved" the trailer of her upcoming film 'Doctor G'.

265.title: Everybody misses him: Shardul on Dhoni ahead of 2nd SA ODI in Ranchi
265.article_body: India bowling all-rounder Shardul Thakur, on being asked about MS Dhoni in the pre-match press conference ahead of their second ODI against South Africa in Ranchi, said, "Everybody misses Dhoni." Shardul added, "Dhoni played more than 300 ODIs...So this much-experienced player, it is rare that you come across such an experienced player. We miss him definitely."

266.title: N Korea fires 2 ballistic missiles, seventh launch since Sept 25
266.article_body: North Korea fired two short-range ballistic missiles towards its eastern waters on Sunday, according to authorities in South Korea and Japan. This is the seventh missile launch by North Korea since September 25. A day earlier, North Korea said that missile launches are a "planned self-defence measure to protect the country's security and regional peace from direct US military threats".

267.title: Toyota says nearly 3 lakh pieces of customer info possibly leaked
267.article_body: Toyota Motor Corporation has said that about 2,96,000 pieces of customer information such as email addresses and numbers may have been leaked from its T-Connect, a telematics service that connects vehicles via a network. It further said that the affected customers are individuals who have been signed up on the service's website since July 2017.

268.title: India reports 2,756 new COVID-19 cases, active cases stand at 28,593
268.article_body: India reported 2,756 new COVID-19 cases in the last 24 hours, according to Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. The data showed that 3,393 people recovered in the last 24 hours following which the active COVID-19 cases in the country dropped to 28,593. The COVID-19 death toll in the country reached 5,28,799, while the daily positivity rate stood at 1.15%.

269.title: Can't be more grateful: Abdu on B'wood debut with 'Kisi Ka Bhai...'
269.article_body: Tajikistan's social media star Abdu Rozik said he "cannot be more grateful" to Salman Khan for giving him the opportunity to star in 'Kisi Ka Bhai Kisi Ki Jaan'. "I hope I can repay him one day for this opportunity," Abdu said, adding he's "nervous and excited" about his Bollywood debut. Abdu also dedicated his first Hindi single to Salman.

270.title: Yellow alert issued for parts of Maharashtra for next 3 to 4 days: IMD
270.article_body: The India Meteorological Department (IMD) issued a yellow alert for parts of central Maharashtra, Marathwada and Konkan for the next three to four days. "Mostly for the entire Maharashtra, there are expectations of thundershowers associated with isolated heavy rainfall," an IMD official said. Several parts of Mumbai faced waterlogging due to incessant rains on Saturday.

271.title: PM Modi to hold 40 rallies in 144 LS seats lost in 2019 polls: Reports
271.article_body: The BJP is planning to conduct 40 rallies across the 144 Lok Sabha seats it lost in the 2019 polls. According to reports, PM Narendra Modi will hold 40 big rallies in 40 clusters. BJP National President JP Nadda, Union Home Minister Amit Shah and other leaders are likely to hold public meetings in the remaining 104 seats.

272.title: Panic of the BJP govt: Rahul Gandhi after attack on Cong MLA in Gujarat
272.article_body: Following the attack on Congress MLA and tribal leader Anant Patel in Gujarat on Saturday, Congress leader Rahul Gandhi tweeted, "This is the panic of the BJP government." Rahul further wrote, "Attack on our MLA...by the BJP is condemnable." Patel has alleged that he was thrashed by goons led by the Navsari district panchayat president.

273.title: Rafael Nadal becomes father for the first time, blessed with a baby boy
273.article_body: Twenty two-time Grand Slam champion Rafael Nadal and his wife Xisca Perelló have been blessed with their first child, a baby boy. The couple, who have been together since 2005 and tied the knot in 2019, have reportedly named their son 'Rafael'. Xisca delivered the baby in a private clinic in Mallorca.

274.title: I bought Pixel just to use 5G and it's not showing 5G network option: Paytm CEO
274.article_body: Paytm CEO Vijay Shekhar Sharma tweeted that he bought the Google Pixel 6a only to use 5G but it wasn't showing the 5G network option in Delhi even after upgrades. He shared a screenshot saying the device manufacturer is yet to release 5G software upgrade. Tagging Google, he asked, "Do you think India should get 5G handset software upgrade soon?"

275.title: Supporting Ukraine to cost SpaceX $100 million by 2022 end: Musk
275.article_body: SpaceX CEO Elon Musk took to Twitter to respond to a Financial Times article discussing Ukrainian soldiers experiencing Starlink outages, and said, "This operation has cost SpaceX $80 million and will exceed $100 million by end of [the] year." "This article falsely claims that Starlink terminals and service were paid for when only a small percentage have been," he added.

276.title: DNA test to identify completely charred bodies in Nashik bus accident
276.article_body: The Maharashtra Police will conduct DNA and some other forensic tests to ascertain the identity of the deceased in Maharashtra's Nashik bus accident, which claimed 12 lives so far. The police and local administration were able to identify seven of the total 12 deceased by Saturday evening. Some of the survivors also reportedly assisted police in identifying the victims.

277.title: Bharat Jodo Yatra not conceived as 'chunav jitao yatra': Cong's Jairam
277.article_body: Congress' Jairam Ramesh said the party’s Bharat Jodo Yatra was seen as a yatra to revive, resuscitate and reinvigorate Congress party organisation around a national narrative other than political power. "This was never conceived as a 'chunav jitao yatra' when it was conceived in Udaipur. It was seen as a yatra to rejuvenate Congress," The Print quoted him as saying.

278.title: Heavy rainfall causes waterlogging in several areas in Delhi; pics surface
278.article_body: Several areas in Delhi faced waterlogging and traffic jams following heavy rainfall. The traffic police also issued an advisory for six stretches of roads, like Aurobindo Marg and Dhaula Kuan flyover, which were affected by waterlogging or potholes and asked commuters to avoid them. According to IMD, rainfall is likely to persist on Sunday in the national capital.

279.title: 'Rocky Aur Rani Ki Prem Kahani' is a celebratory film: Karan Johar
279.article_body: Director Karan Johar said his film 'Rocky Aur Rani Ki Prem Kahani' is a "celebratory film", which has "all the elements" that he loves watching and having as a part of his films. He added he's "very privileged" to have worked with Dharmendra, Jaya Bachchan and Shabana Azmi in the film, which he also described as a "family love story".

280.title: Middle-order will remain an issue for Pak: Hafeez on Pak's T20I vs NZ
280.article_body: Reacting to Pakistan's decision to promote Shadab Khan and Muhammad Nawaz in their recent T20I against New Zealand, ex-Pakistan all-rounder Mohammad Hafeez tweeted, "It'll put more...[doubt] in the minds of [the] middle-order batters." "If [there's] no confidence [in] them, then why're they with the team? Middle order will remain an issue," added Hafeez. Pakistan beat New Zealand by six wickets.

281.title: Cong MLA attacked in Gujarat, told 'won't let an an Adivasi walk here'
281.article_body: Congress MLA Anant Patel was attacked by goons at Khergam town in the Navsari district of Gujarat on Saturday. Patel has alleged that the attack was carried out by the Navsari district panchayat president Bhikhubhai Ahir. He further said that the goons made casteist slurs and said, "You're becoming a leader being an Adivasi. Won't let an Adivasi walk here."

282.title: Ayushmann's 'Doctor G' gets 'A' certification from CBFC: Report
282.article_body: Central Board of Film Certification (CBFC) has reportedly cleared Ayushmann Khurrana and Rakul Preet Singh's 'Doctor G' with an 'A' certificate. Reportedly, CBFC members felt some of the terms and jokes in the film "were not family friendly" and the makers weren't in favour of cutting scenes and dialogues. Hence, the makers decided to go for the adult rating.

283.title: Delhi Police issues traffic advisory in view of religious processions
283.article_body: The Delhi Police issued traffic advisory regarding traffic arrangements in view of 'Shobha Yatra' of Maharishi Valmiki and Eid-e-Milad-un-Nabi processions to be taken out today. As per the advisory, there will be restrictions on movement of traffic on Netaji Subhash Marg, Chawri Bazar Road, Ajmeri Gate Road, Desh Bandhu Gupta Road, Chitra Gupta Road, Panchkuian Marg and Mandir Marg.

284.title: Before end of 2024, UP roads will be equivalent to US: Gadkari
284.article_body: Union Minister Nitin Gadkari on Saturday announced road projects worth ₹8,000 crore for Uttar Pradesh. He said that he's promised state CM Yogi Adityanath that before the end of 2024, the state's road infrastructure will be "equivalent to that of...US". He also added that road projects worth ₹5 lakh crore will be done in the state before end of 2024.

285.title: India releases statement after Pak, Germany's remarks on J&K, mentions 26/11 attacks
285.article_body: India has responded after German Foreign Minister called for UN's engagement in J&K during a joint presser with Pakistan's Bilawal Bhutto. Highlighting cross-border terrorism in J&K and other states, India said UNSC is still pursuing Pakistan-based terrorists involved in 26/11 attacks. "When states do not recognise such dangers...[they] do grave injustice to the victims of terrorism," India noted.

286.title: David Miller's young fan passes away ahead of 2nd ODI against India, he shares pics
286.article_body: South Africa batter David Miller's young fan and close friend's daughter Ane passed away ahead of second India-South Africa ODI. Miller shared a video comprising pictures of Ane. "RIP you little rockstar...Love you always!" Miller wrote. "You taught me so much about cherishing every single moment in life! I feel humbled to have walked a journey with you," he added.

287.title: Wherever you enter in UP, you will get four-lane connectivity: CM Yogi
287.article_body: UP CM Yogi Adityanath on Saturday said, "Wherever you enter in UP, you'll get four-lane connectivity." While addressing an event, CM Yogi said UP is moving ahead in the field of infrastructure under the inspiration of PM Narendra Modi. "Today UP is the front-runner in implementing FDR technology. Our rural roads are being built with this technology," CM Yogi stated.

288.title: BJP wants to create animosity: Shivakumar on renaming of Tipu Express
288.article_body: Karnataka Pradesh Congress Committee President DK Shivakumar criticised the BJP for renaming Tipu Express and said that the party wants everyone to fight and create animosity within the communities. "We are not saying that you should not keep Wodeyar's name. Start another 4-5 trains and keep everyone's name. But the removal of Tipu's name is not right," said Shivakumar.

289.title: Schools teaching 'if you're rich, you're evil': Musk on daughter who cut ties with him
289.article_body: The world's richest person Elon Musk spoke to Financial Times about his relationship with his teenage daughter who recently came out as transgender and cut ties with him. Musk blamed his daughter's decision on the supposed takeover of elite schools and universities by neo-Marxists and said, "It's full-on communism...and a general sentiment that if you're rich, you're evil."

290.title: Musk sought 30% discount before offering to buy Twitter again for $44 bn: Report
290.article_body: The world’s richest person Elon Musk reportedly asked for a 30% discount for Twitter before reviving his original bid of $44 billion. As per a report, Musk's team sought a 30% price reduction, which would have valued Twitter at around $31 billion. However, Twitter rejected the offer and while the discussion moved to a 10% discount, that too was rejected.

291.title: BJP leader booked for allegedly cheating builder of ₹15 crore in Pune
291.article_body: The Pune Police have lodged a cheating case against BJP leader and former corporator Ramakrishna Govindaswamy Pillay in Pimpri for allegedly cheating a builder of ₹15 crore. The case is related to land fraud that took place between February 2019 and May 2022. No arrests have been made so far.

292.title: We're taking notes: 'Adipurush' director on criticism against the film
292.article_body: 'Adipurush' director Om Raut said that he and his team are "taking notes" of all the criticism the film's teaser has received. "For us, our audience is supreme. So, all the sages, our elders, whoever is telling us things, we are taking note of it," Raut said. The director guaranteed that the Prabhas starrer won't "disappoint anyone".

293.title: 665 rare, exotic animals seized in an import consignment in Mumbai
293.article_body: The Directorate of Revenue Intelligence (DRI) in Mumbai recovered 665 animals of exotic species including pythons, lizards, turtles and iguanas in an import consignment, officials said. The recovery was one of the biggest seizures of rare and exotic wildlife species in Mumbai in recent years, the officials added. The animals were found concealed in cartons containing fish.

294.title: Newly-bought car crashes into a row of parked bikes, tilts on 2 wheels, video viral
294.article_body: A video of a newly-bought car, decorated with a garland, crashing into a row of parked bikes and then tilting on its two wheels has gone viral. The video was shared by Twitter user Sqn Ldr Vinod Kumar (Retd), captioned, "What a grand arrival home?" While the location wasn't revealed, the incident took place inside an apartment complex last Thursday.

295.title: Growing up on sets made me the kind of artiste I’m today: Ajay Devgn
295.article_body: Ajay Devgn said his experiences on film sets have "contributed to the kind of artiste" he's transformed into today. The actor-filmmaker, who made his acting debut with 'Phool Aur Kaante' (1991), will be next seen in 'Thank God', 'Drishyam 2' and 'Maidaan'. His next directorial venture is 'Bholaa', which is a Hindi remake of the Tamil film 'Kaithi'.

296.title: Don't put pressure on him all the time: Karim on Dhawan's 4(16) in 1st SA ODI
296.article_body: Ex-selector Saba Karim has said there's no need to put pressure on Shikhar Dhawan over his performance "all the time". "There will be...matches where he won't score runs. [But] I think the selectors have decided that Rohit and Dhawan will be the openers in the [2023] WC," added Karim. Dhawan scored 4(16) in the first ODI against South Africa.

297.title: Meta cancels internship offers in UK amid cost-cutting, Apple Co-founder reacts
297.article_body: Apple Co-founder Steve Wozniak took to Twitter to comment on a report about Meta withdrawing internship offers for London-based recruits, who were to start from January 2023, amid cost-cutting measures. Wozniak wrote, "When COVID prevented our house workers from coming, Janet and I made the sacrifice to continue paying their full salaries because it was the right thing to do."

298.title: Cong chief poll candidates people of stature, can’t be remote controlled: Rahul
298.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Saturday described party Presidential poll candidates Mallikarjun Kharge and Shashi Tharoor as people of stature and understanding. "Both the people who are standing have a position and perspective…I don’t think either of them is going to be a remote control (party chief) and frankly, this tone is insulting to both of them," Gandhi added.

299.title: CBI questions Tejashwi's personal secretary in land-for-jobs scam in railways
299.article_body: The CBI on Saturday questioned the private secretary of Bihar Deputy CM Tejashwi Yadav in connection with the land-for-jobs scam in the railways. This comes after CBI filed a chargesheet against RJD chief Lalu Prasad Yadav, his wife Rabri Devi and their daughter Misa Bharti in the case. A total of 16 people have been named in the chargesheet.

300.title: Newborn girl found amid garbage dump in Delhi, taken to hospital
300.article_body: A police station in Delhi on Saturday received a call in which the caller informed the police that he'd found a newborn girl lying amid a garbage dump and brought the baby home as it was raining, DCP (South West) said. Following this, the baby was handed over to police who took her to a hospital, DCP (South West) added.

301.title: Finance Minister buys vegetables from street vendor in Chennai; shares pics
301.article_body: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman shared pictures and a video of her buying vegetables from a street vendor in Chennai. "During her day-long visit to Chennai, Smt Nirmala Sitharaman made a halt at Mylapore market where she interacted with the vendors & local residents and also purchased vegetables," her office tweeted. The video showed locals coming to greet her.

302.title: Family is my priority, it's okay if I've to sacrifice good films: Kareena
302.article_body: Kareena Kapoor Khan said her family is her priority and she feels it's okay to sacrifice a few good films or scripts for them "because it's worth it". She revealed that between husband Saif Ali Khan and her, one parent is always looking after their kids - Taimur Ali Khan and Jeh Ali Khan. "We keep taking turns," Kareena added.

303.title: Hyderabad police seize ₹79 lakh hawala money, arrest 4 people
303.article_body: Hyderabad's Chandrayangutta police arrested four people and seized ₹79 lakh hawala money on Saturday. The arrests were made after police spotted people exchanging bags under suspicious circumstances and on checking the bags, found the money. During interrogation, it was revealed that two of the accused planned to do hawala activities as their earnings aren't sufficient to meet family expenses.

304.title: 100 new electric buses to join Bengaluru's public transport
304.article_body: The Bengaluru Metropolitan Transport Corporation (BMTC) received 100 new electric buses from the electric vehicle company Switch Mobility. For each electric bus, the central government has funded ₹55 lakh and the Karnataka government funded ₹33.33 lakh. The e-buses are non-AC and 12-metre-long with a seating capacity of 40 people and have a wheel-chair mechanism which is electrically operated.

305.title: Kanye returns to Twitter after Instagram restricts account, posts pic with Zuckerberg
305.article_body: Rapper Kanye West posted on Twitter for the first time in nearly two years after his Instagram account was restricted for violating its policies. Posting a picture of himself with Meta CEO Mark Zuckerberg, he tweeted, "Look at this Mark...How you gone kick me off instagram." Kanye had shared a now-deleted post on Instagram that was criticised for being anti-Semitic.

306.title: Mumbai's Shahad Bridge to be widened by MMRDA
306.article_body: The Mumbai Metropolitan Region Development Authority (MMRDA) has developed a plan to widen the Shahad Bridge that falls on the Kalyan-Murbad-Ahmednagar route. This bridge, which is currently 10 metres wide, will be widened by 30 metres. Around two lakh vehicles reportedly use the bridge daily, many of these being trucks carrying vegetables from the rural parts of Murbad, Ahmednagar.

307.title: Cong shares videos of Bharat Jodo Yatra as march completes 1 month
307.article_body: Congress took to Twitter on Saturday to share videos and photographs from Bharat Jodo Yatra as the march completed one month. It said Congress leader Rahul Gandhi made the "first call to unite India" by starting the yatra on September 7. The party also shared a picture where Rahul Gandhi is seen delivering a speech amid heavy rain in Karnataka.

308.title: US, Japan hold joint drill in light of North Korean missile launches
308.article_body: Japan and the US are conducting a joint military drill involving US aircraft carrier Ronald Reagan in Japan's vicinity in light of North Korea's repeated missile launches, Tokyo said on Saturday. North Korea fired two short-range ballistic missiles on Thursday that landed outside Japan's exclusive economic zone. Prior to that, Pyongyang fired an intermediate-range missile over Japan on Tuesday.

309.title: Reality is, I won't be on the grid in 2023 F1 season: Ricciardo
309.article_body: McLaren driver Daniel Ricciardo has admitted that he will not be driving in F1 for the 2023 season and is focusing on securing an opportunity for the 2024 season. "I think that there could be some better opportunities then...and now where the sights are set," said Ricciardo. He is reportedly in contention to be the Mercedes reserve driver for 2023.

310.title: I am going to call it a draw: Ponting on Hardik vs Maxwell debate
310.article_body: Ex-Australian skipper Ricky Ponting has commented on the debate on which player between Hardik Pandya and Glenn Maxwell will have more impact in the upcoming T20 World Cup. "I think Maxwell will end up scoring more runs than Hardik. And I think Hardik will take more wickets than Maxwell. So, I'm going to call that one a draw," Ponting said.

311.title: Sad for tournament & fans that Medvedev retired mid-match: Djokovic
311.article_body: Tennis star Novak Djokovic said he is "sad" for the Astana Open tournament and the fans after Daniil Medvedev retired midway through their semifinal clash. "He wouldn't retire a match if he didn't feel that he (could) continue...I would probably say he was a better player (today)," said Djokovic. The match was poised at 4-6, 7-6(6) when the Russian retired.

312.title: Excited about WC; I know Australian conditions, grounds: Chahal
312.article_body: Indian spinner Yuzvendra Chahal said that he is excited about the upcoming T20 World Cup. "I have been here (Australia) before...so I know the conditions and the grounds," Chahal said. He added, "When there's [some] bounce in the wicket, you need not bowl fast...[and] focus on bowling the top spinner. The batters might not always connect cross-batted shots here."

313.title: Ronaldo, Messi are greatest ever players but time catches up with all: Rooney
313.article_body: Ex-footballer Wayne Rooney said that Cristiano Ronaldo and Lionel Messi are two of the greatest players to ever play football but time catches up with everybody. "He's (Ronaldo) obviously not the player he was when he was 22 or 23, for instance. It's a tough one for him," Rooney said. Ronaldo and Rooney played together for Manchester United from 2004-09.

314.title: Rahul means Bharat, Bharat means Rahul: UP Congress chief Khabri
314.article_body: Reacting to Congress MP Rahul Gandhi-led Bharat Jodo Yatra, newly-appointed President of Uttar Pradesh Congress Brijlal Khabri said, "Rahul means Bharat, and Bharat means Rahul." Responding to queries on why the yatra is scheduled to pass through just one district in Uttar Pradesh, Khabri said, "Bharat is not a district nor it is a state. It's a union of states."

315.title: 8 killed in clashes between pro-govt forces and Houthis in Yemen
315.article_body: At least eight people were killed in clashes between Yemen's pro-government forces and the Houthi rebels in the country's disputed Yafa area. Four troops were killed from both sides and five others were injured. The two sides have been fighting since 2015 after the Iran-backed Houthi rebels captured capital Sanaa, leading to a response from a Saudi Arabia-led coalition.

316.title: Ready to give the best for my team: Shafali after India's win vs Bangladesh
316.article_body: Following India's 59-run win against Bangladesh in Women's Asia Cup, India opener Shafali Verma, who was adjudged 'Player of the Match', said, "I'm always ready to give my best for the team with the bat and ball." She added, "It was a bit difficult pitch for batting as the ball kept low." Shafali scored a 44-ball 55 and posted 2/10.

317.title: Missing T20 WC berth is big setback but lot of cricket still left: Shardul
317.article_body: Indian seamer Shardul Thakur said that missing out on a berth in the squad for the upcoming T20 World Cup is a "big setback" for him. "Every player dreams to play in the WC...It's okay [that] I'm not selected," Thakur said. He added, "But there's still a lot of cricket left and also there's the ODI WC next year."

318.title: Goa to host 37th National Games in October 2023: IOA
318.article_body: Goa will host the 37th National Games in October next year, the Indian Olympic Association said on Saturday. "The dates of the 37th National Games will be decided keeping in view the dates of 19th Asian Games, which will be held from September 23 to October 8, 2023, in Hangzhou, China," added IOA.

319.title: I've been focussing on my batting since some time now: Shardul
319.article_body: Ahead of India-South Africa second ODI, India all-rounder Shardul Thakur said he has been focussing on his batting since a while. "Batting at seven, eight or nine if these batters can add runs to the total, it is great," he added. Shardul, who batted at number seven in first ODI, scored 33 runs off 31 balls.

320.title: Won't call Dhawan-led Indian ODI side second string: SA spinner Maharaj
320.article_body: South Africa spinner Keshav Maharaj said he wouldn't call Shikhar Dhawan-led India a "second-string" side after his side defeated the hosts by nine runs in first ODI in Lucknow on Thursday. "India have so much talent that they can field four-five proper international sides...There are world class performers out there," he added. Second ODI will be played on Sunday.

321.title: Kejriwal chants 'Jai Shri Ram' at rally amid poster row in Gujarat
321.article_body: Delhi Chief Minister and AAP Convener Arvind Kejriwal chanted "Jai Shri Ram" and "Jai Shri Krishna" at the party's rally in Gujarat after posters targeting him emerged in the state on Saturday. Some posters called him "anti-Hindu". Kejriwal claimed the posters have used words which are insulting gods along with him. He further said that he's a very religious person.

322.title: I'll be forced to leave Punjab if no arrests are made: Shehnaaz's father on death threats
322.article_body: Actress Shehnaaz Gill's father Santokh Singh, who has alleged that he received death threats from an unknown person via phone call, said he'll be forced to leave Punjab and settle elsewhere if no arrests are made. "I think they want to target me because I am Hindu leader," he stated. The caller allegedly told that he'd kill him before Diwali.

323.title: Shocked: Maiden Pharma on its cough syrups being blamed for 66 kids' deaths in Gambia
323.article_body: After WHO issued an alert against four cough and cold syrups manufactured by India's Maiden Pharmaceuticals, which allegedly called the death of 66 children in Gambia, the company issued a statement expressing 'shock and sadness' over the deaths. It said they're not selling any cough syrups in the domestic market, adding, "We have valid drug approvals for exports."

324.title: Indian mission in UK investigating illegal visa agents
324.article_body: The Indian High Commission in London said it is probing reports that illegal agents are charging fees to process visas of travellers going to India from the UK. The statement comes amid reports there is a shortage of visas for British tourists. "It has come to our notice that unauthorised agents...are illegally charging fees," the High Commission said.

325.title: NASA releases new pic of Jupiter's ice-covered moon Europa captured by Juno
325.article_body: NASA has shared a new picture of Jupiter's Europa moon, which is the smallest of the gas giant's four Galilean moons and also the sixth largest moon in our solar system. The picture was taken by NASA's Juno spacecraft on September 29, 2022. It revealed the "complex, ice-covered surface" of Europa as captured by Juno during its flyby.

326.title: Pierre Gasly joins Alpine F1 for 2023, Alpha Tauri signs Nyck de Vries
326.article_body: Driver Pierre Gasly will replace two-time world champion Fernando Alonso at Alpine F1 next season. Meanwhile, Dutchman Nyck de Vries, who made his F1 debut at last month's Italian Grand Prix, will replace Gasly at Alpha Tauri. "They have a complete package and similar ambitions to mine," said Gasly, who will partner fellow Frenchman Esteban Ocon in the French team.

327.title: It's a big setback: Shardul Thakur on not being selected in India's T20 World Cup squad
327.article_body: Bowling all-rounder Shardul Thakur, talking about not being selected in India's T20 World Cup 2022 squad, said, "Of course, it's a big setback. Every player dreams to play in World Cup...not just play but win it as well." He added, "It's okay...I'm not selected this time...but there's still lot of cricket left and also there's ODI World Cup next year."

328.title: 3 J&K men experimenting with de-addiction meds inject drugs, held
328.article_body: The Srinagar Police on Saturday sent three men to a de-addiction centre after a video purportedly showing them injecting drugs into each other in Jammu and Kashmir's Noorbagh village surfaced online. An investigation has revealed that the trio was experimenting with medicines provided by a de-addiction centre, by injecting them into their veins instead of orally taking them, police said.

329.title: AR Murugadoss and Suriya to team up for 'Ghajini 2': Reports
329.article_body: Director AR Murugadoss and actor Suriya are reportedly reuniting for the second instalment of 'Ghajini'. It will mark third collaboration between Murugadoss and Suriya. The Tamil film, which was released in 2005, also featured Asin, Nayanthara and Pradeep Singh Rawat. The film was remade in Hindi starring Aamir Khan in the lead role.

330.title: Cristiano Ronaldo often fighting with Man Utd manager ten Hag: Report
330.article_body: Manchester United forward Cristiano Ronaldo is reportedly often fighting with manager Erik ten Hag behind the scenes due to differences in opinion. Ronaldo is said to have repeatedly complained about the nature and quality of training sessions and believes the club needs to play a different system. The player also reportedly considers the manager to be stubborn with his methods.

331.title: TRS cannot become national party by changing name: Cong's Kharge
331.article_body: Senior Congress leader Mallikarjun Kharge on Saturday said that the Telangana Rashtra Samithi (TRS) cannot become a national party by changing its name. He said that several regional parties changed their names in the past to go national, but nothing happened. "ADMK became AIADMK, TMC became All India TMC. Did they become national parties," Kharge questioned.

332.title: Woman to donate her uterus to daughter in Australia so she can get pregnant again
332.article_body: An Australian woman is set to receive her mother's uterus as part of a clinical trial at the Royal Hospital for Women in Sydney. Kirsty Bryant, 29, had to undergo a hysterectomy after suffering from post-partum haemorrhage in 2021. If the transplant surgery is successful, she'll potentially give birth to a baby from the same womb she was born from.

333.title: Nike suspends relationship with Hockey Canada amid sex assault allegations
333.article_body: Nike has suspended its relationship with Hockey Canada as the organisation faces "increased scrutiny" over its handling of sexual assault allegations, the world's largest sportswear maker said on Friday. In May, news of an alleged group sexual assault involving members of Canada's 2018 world junior team and subsequent out-of-court settlement had emerged.

334.title: India's 18-year-old Shafali breaks world record, becomes youngest to score 1,000 T20I runs
334.article_body: India's 18-year-old opener Shafali Verma has broken the world record for being the fastest batter to reach 1,000 runs in T20I cricket. She achieved the feat during India's Women's Asia Cup 2022 match on Saturday. Shafali got to 1,000 runs aged 18 years and 253 days. This record was earlier held by Jemimah Rodrigues aged 21 years and 32 days.

335.title: Sitharaman says KCR changed party's name 'on Tantrik's advice'
335.article_body: Union Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman on Saturday alleged that Telangana CM K Chandrashekar Rao renamed his party from Telangana Rashtra Samiti (TRS) to Bharat Rashtra Samiti (BRS) on a "Tantrik's advice". Following the advice of "Tantriks and numerologists", Rao "did not...induct women for many years in his cabinet" and "stopped going to the Secretariat", Sitharaman added, as per ANI.

336.title: President Murmu, Rajnath Singh attend IAF's 90th anniversary show
336.article_body: President Murmu and Defence Minister Rajnath Singh attended the Indian Air Force's 90th-anniversary celebrations in Chandigarh on Saturday. "The nation is proud of IAF for bravely guarding our skies and rendering help during calamities," the President tweeted. Singh described the IAF's show as "breathtaking". Haryana CM Manohar Lal Khattar and Chandigarh MP Kirron Kher also attended the event.

337.title: Insurgency and drug trafficking are 2 sides of a coin: Amit Shah
337.article_body: Union Home Minister Amit Shah said seizing narcotics alone was not enough but the entire channel of drug movement from trafficker to consumer must be destroyed. He said, "Insurgency along with arms trade and drug trafficking are two sides of a coin." Shah made the comments while speaking at the 'Drug Trafficking and National Security' meeting in Guwahati on Saturday.

338.title: Expected a very positive response to 'Adipurush' teaser: Director Om
338.article_body: 'Adipurush' director Om Raut said he expected a very positive response to the film's teaser. "It's kind of mixed. There are a lot of people who're saying good things about it. There are some people who're not, and there are some differences in their minds," he added. Om further said people won't be disappointed after watching the film in January.

339.title: Brijlal Khabri assumes charge as Congress chief of Uttar Pradesh
339.article_body: Former BSP MP Brijlal Khabri took charge as the new President of Uttar Pradesh Congress Committee at party's state headquarters on Saturday. "Khabri paid floral tributes to Mahatma Gandhi and Babasaheb Ambedkar, and vowed to fight against the corrupt government," the party's state wing tweeted. The 61-year-old leader, who belongs to the Dalit community, had joined the Congress in 2016.

340.title: Delhi records 137 new COVID-19 cases, 1 death
340.article_body: Delhi reported 137 fresh cases of COVID-19 with a positivity rate of 1.73% in the last 24 hours, the city health department informed on Saturday. One death due to the infection was also recorded in the national capital, as per the daily COVID-19 bulletin. The city's active case count stood at 397, the bulletin said.

341.title: Rahul Gandhi to vote from 'yatra' campsite for Congress chief poll
341.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi and 40 party delegates, who are involved in the 'Bharat Jodo Yatra', will be voting for the Congress' presidential election from a campsite in Karnataka's Ballari district. The voters will take a break from the 'Yatra' and cast their ballots. The voting will be held on October 17 and results will be declared on October 19.

342.title: Prashant Kishor wanted me to merge JD(U) & Congress: Nitish Kumar
342.article_body: Bihar CM Nitish Kumar claimed that poll strategist Prashant Kishor had once asked him to merge JD(U) with the Congress. "He came to meet me recently...I did not invite him...Whatever he says, doesn't make any sense," said Kumar. Kishor on Tuesday claimed that Kumar called him to his residence recently and asked him to lead the JD(U).

343.title: If you take religion, I'm also not a Hindu: SS Rajamouli
343.article_body: Highlighting the difference between the Hindu religion and Hindu dharma, filmmaker SS Rajamouli said, "Before Hinduism the religion, there existed Hinduism the dharma." While dharma is a way of life, religion is a philosophy, he added. "If you take the religion, I'm also not a Hindu, but if you take the dharma, I'm very much a Hindu," Rajamouli said.

344.title: I'm sent by God to finish off Kansa's descendants: Kejriwal on Gujarat posters
344.article_body: AAP chief Arvind Kejriwal reacted to the posters calling him "anti-Hindu" that were pasted across Gujarat and said that God has sent him with a special task to finish off demon Kansa's descendants and rid the public of corruption and hooligans. "We'll work together to fulfil God's desire. God is with me. People are with me," Kejriwal said.

345.title: CBI examines ex-Governor Satya Pal Malik in J&K corruption cases
345.article_body: Former Meghalaya Governor Satya Pal Malik has been questioned by the CBI in connection with two graft cases registered in Jammu and Kashmir in April based on allegations levelled by him. Malik had claimed that he was offered a ₹300 crore-bribe for clearing two files during his tenure as J&K's Governor between August 23, 2018 and October 30, 2019.

346.title: BJP aims to win 12 of 14 Lok Sabha seats in Assam for 2024 polls: CM
346.article_body: Assam CM Himanta Biswa Sarma on Saturday said the BJP has set a target of winning 12 out of 14 seats in Assam in the 2024 Lok Sabha elections. "We will not stop till...Lok Sabha polls. We want to see Narendra Modi as Prime Minister for the third time," Sarma said, adding BJP won nine seats in Assam last time.

347.title: 'Palace on Wheels' resumes service after 2-yr COVID-19-induced gap
347.article_body: Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot flagged off the 'Palace on Wheels' luxury train on Saturday, after a coronavirus-forced two-year break. "Its (the train's) resumption indicates that (the) tourism sector...is going to emerge stronger," Gehlot said at the Gandhinagar Railway Station. He said additional amenities have been added to the train by the Railways and the Rajasthan Tourism Development Corporation.

348.title: Daycare worker chases crying kid in Halloween mask in US, fired as video goes viral
348.article_body: A woman working at a daycare centre in the US was fired after a video of her scaring children while wearing a 'Scream' Halloween mask went viral online.
