A video showed her chasing a crying child and another showed her getting close to a boy and asking him, "Have you been bad, do you want me to take you outside!"

349.title: 7 Djiboutian soldiers killed by 'terrorists', prez adviser says
349.article_body: Seven soldiers were killed in clashes between the army and "a terrorist group" on Thursday night in northern Djibouti, a presidential adviser told Reuters on Saturday. The presidential aide blamed the Front for the Restoration of Unity and Democracy (FRUD) for the attack. FRUD has, however, denied responsibility for the attack and pinned the blame on a splinter group instead.

350.title: EC freezes Shiv Sena's election symbol amid fight between Uddhav, Shinde camps
350.article_body: The Election Commission (EC) on Saturday said neither former Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray's camp nor the Eknath Shinde-led faction will be permitted to use Shiv Sena's 'bow and arrow' symbol in the Andheri East bypoll. As per EC's order, both groups shall be allotted different symbols which they may choose from the list of free symbols notified by the EC.

351.title: Heroin worth ₹350 cr seized from Pakistani boat off Gujarat coast
351.article_body: In a joint operation, the Indian Coast Guard and Gujarat ATS seized nearly 50 kg heroin, worth ₹350 crores, from a Pakistani boat on the intervening night of October 7 and 8, an ATS official said. Six crew members were also apprehended. The boat was spotted moving suspiciously in Indian waters, 40 nautical miles from Jakhau port, the official added.

352.title: Svante Pääbo's friends toss him into pond to celebrate his Nobel Prize win
352.article_body: Swedish scientist Svante Pääbo's friends tossed him into water at Germany's Max Planck Institute for Evolutionary Anthropology to celebrate his Nobel Prize in Medicine win. "Normally throwing a colleague into...pond happens when somebody receives a PhD, and [Svante's colleagues] wanted to do it for his Nobel Prize as well," the Twitter account of The Nobel Prize wrote sharing a video.

353.title: 40,000 kg drugs destroyed in Northeast in presence of Amit Shah
353.article_body: About 40,000 kg of drugs, seized by the Narcotics Control Bureau (NCB) and other agencies, were destroyed in the Northeastern states in the virtual presence of Union Home Minister Amit Shah on Saturday. While 11,000 kg of drugs seized by the NCB were destroyed in Guwahati, another 8,000 kg seized by the government agencies in Assam were also set ablaze.

354.title: BJP supporters tear AAP banners ahead of Kejriwal rally in Gujarat
354.article_body: BJP supporters tore apart banners of AAP in Vadodara ahead of Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal and Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann's rally in poll-bound Gujarat on Saturday. They also painted the words "anti-Hindu Kejriwal go back" on a road. BJP supporters were protesting against AAP MLA Rajendra Pal Gautam, who recently attended a religious conversion event where people denounced Hindu deities.

355.title: Man gets challans for violations by scooter with tampered plate, says 'E looks like F'
355.article_body: A Mumbai car owner said he has been issued multiple challans for a two-wheeler he doesn't own. He alleged that due to fuzzy appearance of registration plate, 'EJ' often gets mistaken for 'FJ' and challans are generated on his four-wheeler. After Traffic Police advised him to file grievance, he said he has already filed three grievances but it's "never ending".

356.title: SRK ropes in 'Fauda' creator to train son Aryan as a writer: Report
356.article_body: Actor Shah Rukh Khan has reportedly roped in Israeli actor-writer Lior Raz, the creator of the action-thriller series 'Fauda', to train Aryan Khan for his debut as a writer. According to the report, Aryan is working on a web series which will be backed by Red Chillies Entertainment. The project will reportedly go on floors by the end of 2022.

357.title: Arjun Kapoor is not a part of 'Pushpa 2', confirms producer
357.article_body: 'Pushpa: The Rule - Part 2' producer Naveen Yerneni has refuted reports that claimed actor Arjun Kapoor is in talks to play the role of a police officer in the film. "Fahadh Faasil is doing the role. So it's...[a] false news," Naveen said. He further said the film will go on the floors by the end of this month.

358.title: Tiafoe and Fritz set up all-American final at Japan Open
358.article_body: Fourth seed Frances Tiafoe defeated South Korea's Soonwoo Kwon 6-2, 0-6, 6-4 in semi-final on Saturday to set up an all-American final against Taylor Fritz at Japan Open Tennis Championships. "It was a weird match," said Tiafoe. Third seed Fritz beat Canada's Denis Shapovalov 6-3, 6-7(5-7), 6-3 to advance to his third ATP Tour final of the season.

359.title: Class 9 pass aspiring to be CM: Prashant Kishor on Tejashwi Yadav
359.article_body: Poll strategist Prashant Kishor said Bihar Deputy CM Tejashwi Yadav is someone who has studied till Class nine but "is aspiring to become CM". "If your son has studied up to Class nine, he will not even get a job as a peon," Kishor said in a public address in Bihar. He said common people are at fate's mercy.

360.title: We will solve Assam flood issue if we get 5 more years: Amit Shah
360.article_body: Union Home Minister Amit Shah said the government needs five years to fully solve the perennial flood problem in Assam. "We promised an Assam free from terrorism, corruption and flood. We've already achieved the first two. Give us five more years," said Shah. He added that "an ambitious project" is being prepared under the aegis of the North Eastern Council.

361.title: UK opens new licensing round for oil exploration in North Sea
361.article_body: The UK government has started a fresh licensing round for oil and gas exploration in the North Sea, even as environmentalists have criticised the move. The government contended fuel extraction from the North Sea will create jobs and boost the country's energy security. Climate Minister Graham Stuart said, "When we burn our own gas, it's got lower emissions...than foreign gas."

362.title: Forming CM Shinde's govt took months of planning: Maha minister
362.article_body: Maharashtra minister Chandrakant Patil said the formation of the BJP-Eknath Shinde's Sena government in the state took 'months of planning'. "To keep the morale high...we had to keep saying that 'BJP will soon return to power'...party required 40 MLAs, which was not easy," said Patil. He added that it was "easy" to dislodge the governments in Madhya Pradesh and Karnataka.

363.title: Perhaps saved Assamese society: Cong leader on Shah's 'beaten up' claim
363.article_body: Responding to Union Minister Amit Shah's claim that he was "beaten up" during his visit to Assam by erstwhile CM Hiteswar Saikia, Congress spokesperson Bobbeeta Sharma said Saikia "perhaps...saved Assamese society from dangers of polarization". Recalling his initial days in politics, earlier today, Shah said that he and his fellow ABVP members "were beaten up a lot by Hiteswar Saikia".

364.title: Rahul Gandhi's statement on Savarkar, RSS is full of lies: RSS leader
364.article_body: RSS leader Indresh Kumar on Saturday criticised Congress leader Rahul Gandhi over his statement against VD Savarkar and RSS, calling it "full of lies". "It has become a fashion of Congress to level false allegations against RSS and Savarkar," Kumar said. "This is a form of frustration of Rahul Gandhi's failure in politics," he said, adding Congress divided the country.

365.title: Youngsters will be assigned special roles in next polls: J&K Cong chief
365.article_body: Jammu and Kashmir Congress chief Vikar Rasool Wani promised a special role for youngsters in the next Assembly elections. "Youngsters need to make strenuous efforts to strengthen the party at the grassroot level," Wani said. "The Congress will make the role of the youngsters more vibrant in order to nurture them for future challenges," Wani added.

366.title: 4 including 3 kids killed, 16 hurt as gas cylinders explode in Rajasthan
366.article_body: Four persons, including three children, died and over 16 others sustained injuries after multiple cooking gas cylinders exploded in Rajasthan's Jodhpur, police said on Saturday. The injured persons were taken to Mahatma Gandhi Hospital for treatment. District Collector Himanshu Gupta has ordered a probe into the matter and assured that anyone found responsible would be prosecuted as per law.

367.title: 510 human trafficking cases reported in Germany in 2021: Police
367.article_body: German Police and customs officials responded to 510 human trafficking cases in the country in 2021, which was an increase of 10% from the figure of 2020, the Federal Criminal Police Office said. The average age of the victims was 15 years, it added. The number of children affected due to trafficking was 23% higher in 2021 than in 2020.

368.title: Man tweets pics of glass shards in pizza & tags Mumbai Police, police responds
368.article_body: A man shared pictures of some glass shards that he allegedly found in pizza ordered online from Domino's. "This speaks volumes about global brand food that we're getting," he tweeted while tagging Mumbai Police and FSSAI. "Please write to customer care...If they don't reply or give an unsatisfactory reply, then you can think of a legal remedy," said Police.

369.title: Probe agencies acting on whims: Nitish on chargesheet against Lalu
369.article_body: Bihar CM Nitish Kumar reacted to the CBI chargesheet against RJD President Lalu Prasad Yadav in the land-for-job scam, saying central government probe agencies are "acting upon whims and fancies". "You...may recall what happened...five years ago which caused me to walk out of the alliance...Now that I'm back in alliance (with RJD), a new thing has started," said Kumar.

370.title: BJP will form govt for the 7th time in Gujarat: Ex-CM Vijay Rupani
370.article_body: Gujarat's former CM Vijay Rupani on Saturday said that Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) leaders are assured that the party will win the upcoming state elections and form government in Gujarat for the seventh time. "Our party will touch more than two-thirds of the majority," he added. He claimed people of Gujarat have no faith in Congress or Aam Aadmi Party.

371.title: Muslim minorities have contributed most to Bollywood: Sharad Pawar
371.article_body: NCP chief Sharad Pawar on Friday said that Muslim minorities have made the biggest contribution to Bollywood. "In all the fields, whether it is art...writing, or...poetry, the highest contribution has come from the Minorities, and...in the Urdu language," Pawar said. "Muslim minorities...have contributed the most [to Bollywood], and we cannot ignore their contribution," he added.

372.title: Drunk woman misbehaves with guard, grabs his collar in Noida society; video viral
372.article_body: In a video that has gone viral on social media, a woman in an inebriated state can be seen misbehaving with a security guard of a building in Uttar Pradesh's Noida after an altercation over some matter. She grabs him by the collar and then throws his cap in the air. The incident reportedly took place at Ajnara Homes society.

373.title: Scripts I'm getting now are better than what I was getting a decade ago: Kareena
373.article_body: Actress Kareena Kapoor Khan said in an interview that it's the "age of actors" today. She added that the scripts she's being offered are "way better" than what she was offered a decade ago. "It's an exciting time not just for female actors but every actor across the board," said Kareena, who was recently seen in 'Laal Singh Chaddha'.

374.title: Plea seeks injunction over 'inaccurate portrayal of Hindu gods' in 'Adipurush'
374.article_body: A plea has been filed in a Delhi court seeking an injunction against the movie 'Adipurush', alleging it has depicted Hindu gods in an "unwarranted" and "inaccurate" way in its teaser. The matter has been listed for hearing on Monday. "The defendants have hurt the religious, cultural, historical and civilizational sentiments of the plaintiff and other Hindus," the plea stated.

375.title: Proud of the way girls came back after loss to Pakistan: Smriti
375.article_body: After India's 59-run win over defending champions Bangladesh in Women's Asia Cup 2022, India stand-in captain Smriti Mandhana said it was a total team performance. "It was disappointing in the last match. It is good to come back after that loss, really proud of the girls," she added. India lost their last match against Pakistan by 13 runs.

376.title: 1000s of families benefited: Atlee thanks SRK for shooting Jawan in Chennai
376.article_body: Atlee, director of Shah Rukh Khan's upcoming movie 'Jawan', on Saturday thanked the actor for agreeing to shoot the film in Chennai. He tweeted, "Special thanks to you for having...shoot happen in Chennai, 1000s of family were benefited...'KING IS A KING ALWAYS' a big bow and respect to you sir." Shah Rukh reportedly shot for nearly 30 days in Chennai.

377.title: Cricketers like Hardik Pandya come once in many years: Pollard
377.article_body: West Indies cricketer Kieron Pollard said that players like India's Hardik Pandya come "once in many years". "Let's just enjoy him (Pandya). We tend to put them up on [a] pedestal, and the moment they don't deliver, we drag them down," Pollard said. He added, "I know him for a couple of years and I understand how he thinks."

378.title: 45-yr-old woman killed, 3 others injured in house collapse in Raj
378.article_body: A 45-year-old woman was killed and three others of a family were injured after a wall of their tin-shed house collapsed on Friday in Rajasthan's Baran, police said. Police said 50-year-old Kanshiram Sahariya, his wife Sugna, son Golu and daughter Lila Kumari were asleep when the incident occurred. The woman succumbed to her injuries on the way to the hospital.

379.title: PM Modi to address public rally in Himachal's Chamba on Oct 13
379.article_body: PM Narendra Modi will address a public rally at Himachal Pradesh's Chamba on October 13, marking his second visit to the poll-bound state in less than 10 days. PM Modi will launch 80MW Bajoli hydroelectric project and lay foundation stone of Chanju-III and Deothal Chanju hydel projects, CM Jairam Thakur said. He will also launch Pradhan Mantri Gram Sadak Yojana-III.

380.title: India beat defending champions Bangladesh in Women's Asia Cup
380.article_body: India defeated defending champions Bangladesh by 59 runs in Women's Asia Cup on Saturday. Opener Shafali Verma, adjudged 'Player of the Match', scored 55 runs off 44 balls and returned bowling figures of 4-0-10-2, while all-rounder Deepti Sharma picked up two wickets. Opting to bat, India scored 159/5 in 20 overs. Bangladesh managed 100/7 in 20 overs.

381.title: Sena Bhawan employee arrested for spying for Pakistan
381.article_body: A 31-year-old man has been arrested for allegedly spying for Pakistani intelligence agencies, Rajasthan Police said on Saturday. Ravi Prakash Meena, a resident of Rajasthan, was posted as a class-4 employee at the Sena Bhawan in Delhi, police informed. Meena was honey-trapped by a female Pakistani agent with whom he was sharing confidential and strategic information about the Indian Army.

382.title: Remote-control allegations insulting to Cong Prez candidates: Rahul
382.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Saturday claimed that whoever is elected as the party's new President next month, "will not be remote-controlled" by the Gandhi family and will have a free hand in taking decisions. Senior leaders Mallikarjun Kharge and Shashi Tharoor are fighting for the top post. "Frankly, this tone is insulting to both of them," Gandhi added.

383.title: Heavy to very heavy rainfall warning issued for several states till Oct 12, list released
383.article_body: Heavy to very heavy rainfall is likely over Tamil Nadu and Puducherry on October 9, while it's likely over Uttarakhand and Uttar Pradesh on October 12, as per the IMD. Meanwhile, heavy rainfall is likely over West Bengal, Sikkim, Arunachal Pradesh, Assam and Meghalaya till October 12. Further, it is likely over Madhya Pradesh, Nagaland and Manipur till October 11.

384.title: Rape on pretext of marriage claim not valid if woman has sex knowing man is married: HC
384.article_body: The allegation of rape on the false promise of marriage does not stand if a woman continues to have sexual relations with a man despite knowledge about his married status, the Kerala High Court has said. It said this while quashing a rape case against a 33-year-old man. The relationship between him and the complainant seemed consensual, the HC said.

385.title: Mentally-ill man beaten on suspicion of being child lifter in Chhattisgarh
385.article_body: A mentally-challenged man roaming around Chhattisgarh's Khopli village was allegedly beaten up by a mob on Friday on suspicion of being a child lifter, police said. The victim, who did not suffer injuries in the incident, was rescued by police officers and shifted to a Bilaspur-based government hospital for mentally-challenged people. Police arrested three people aged between 20 and 37.

386.title: I'm back to 100%: England captain Buttler ahead of T20I series vs Australia
386.article_body: Ahead of England-Australia three-match T20I series, England captain Jos Buttler, who sustained a calf injury during The Hundred in August, said, "I'm back to 100 percent." He added, "Had a good time in Pakistan rehabbing, probably could have played earlier, but with...World Cup around the corner, it was the right thing to do." Buttler missed the T20I series against Pakistan.

387.title: 4 masked men rob retired magistrate of laptop, ₹10,500 cash in Raj
387.article_body: Four masked men robbed the house of a retired magistrate named Aditya Narayan Sharma in Rajasthan, police said on Saturday. The armed criminals stole a laptop, a mobile phone, some artificial jewellery and ₹10,500 in cash from his house in Jaipur's Mansarovar area. Police said they are trying to identify the criminals through footage from cameras installed in the area.

388.title: Ranbir Kapoor stops accepting film offers, decides to take paternity leave: Report
388.article_body: Actor Ranbir Kapoor has decided to take paternity leave once his baby is born, said reports. Ranbir, who is completing his work on Sandeep Vanga's 'Animal', hasn't accepted any other project as of now, and will do so only after his paternity leave, reports added. Actress Alia Bhatt will reportedly return to work as soon as she can after delivery.

389.title: 'Anti-Hindu Kejriwal go back' banners emerge in Guj ahead of AAP rally
389.article_body: Banners showing Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal wearing a white skull cap surfaced in Gujarat ahead of the AAP leader's rally in the state on Saturday. Some banners bearing his pictures carried lines like "I consider Hindu religion as madness", while others bore "anti-Hindu Kejriwal go back" message. This comes after Delhi minister Rajendra Pal Gautam attended a religious conversion event.

390.title: Kejriwal promises free Ayodhya Ram Temple visit for Guj residents
390.article_body: AAP National Convenor and Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal, while addressing a gathering in poll-bound Gujarat, promised "free visit to Ayodhya's Ram Temple to people of Gujarat", if the AAP forms the government in the state. This comes after banners and posters calling Kejriwal "anti-Hindu" and showing him purportedly wearing a skull cap surfaced in several cities in the state.

391.title: UP man ends life by hanging from tree after being scolded by parents
391.article_body: A man allegedly ended his life by hanging himself from a tree near Risaura village in Banda, UP on Saturday. The deceased, Deepu Nishad (22), was hurt after being scolded by his parents and this seems to be one of the main reasons behind his death, police said. Notably, police have started with their investigation.

392.title: There's no fight between us: Ali Asgar on equation with Kapil Sharma
392.article_body: Actor-comedian Ali Asgar, speaking about his equation with Kapil Sharma, said, "There were times when I missed his call and on other times, he missed my calls." "There is no fight or anger between us," he added. "I am not rigid about not being part of The Kapil Sharma Show again," said Ali, who quit the show in 2017.

393.title: MCD Special Officer appointed as Principal Secy in Delhi Home Dept
393.article_body: Special Officer of the Municipal Corporation of Delhi (MCD) Ashwani Kumar has been appointed as Principal Secretary (Home) of the Delhi government, an order issued by Lieutenant Governor VK Saxena stated. The 1992 batch IAS officer will continue to hold the charge of Special Officer of MCD. Kumar was appointed as Special Officer by the Home Ministry in May 2022.

394.title: Man stabs mother-in-law to death over property dispute in Telangana
394.article_body: A 45-year-old woman was reportedly stabbed to death by her son-in-law over a property dispute in Telangana's Karimnagar. The accused, along with two of his family members, also attacked the victim's mother, who was sleeping with her. According to police, the victim, a widow, owned five-acre land, and the accused had been asking for a share in her property.

395.title: BJP the only ideology-based party in the country: Nadda in Guwahati
395.article_body: BJP chief JP Nadda said the Congress does not have any particular ideology and BJP is the only ideology-based national party in India. Speaking at the inauguration of Atal Bihari Vajpayee Bhawan in Guwahati, he said, the BJP proposed to set up 512 offices across the country, out of which 236 offices have been constructed and 154 are under construction.

396.title: EOW inspector, ex-Mumbai Police officers booked for filing fake case
396.article_body: Mumbai Police has registered a case against seven persons, including two of its retired officers and an Economic Offences Wing (EOW) inspector, for allegedly getting an MHADA official jailed in a false case. The complainant alleged that police fabricated evidence and witnesses against him. The official was accused of cheating people on the pretext of providing flats at cheap rates.

397.title: Liquor sale banned in east B'luru tomorrow on account of Eid-e-Milad
397.article_body: On account of Eid-e-Milad-un-Nabi on Sunday, police have banned the sale of liquor in parts of east Bengaluru. Clubs and five-star hotels in the area have, however, been exempted from the ban. "On the occasion of Eid-e-Milad, there will be processions...to maintain peace and security the sale of liquor is prohibited," an order issued by the city Police Commissioner stated.

398.title: Delhi civic ward delimitation report to be sent to Centre next week: Officials
398.article_body: The panel, which is tasked with the delimitation exercise of civic wards in Delhi, is expected to present its report next week to the Union Home Ministry, officials said. The panel's draft report has reduced the number of wards in Delhi from 272 to 250. It also suggested that the number of municipalities in the 23 Assembly constituencies be reduced.

399.title: Few Mumbai Central Railway suburban lines to be blocked tomorrow
399.article_body: The Central Railway in Mumbai said services on some of its suburban rail lines will be blocked due to maintenance work on Sunday. Thane-Kalyan Up and Down fast lines and Kurla-Vashi Up and Down Harbour lines will be blocked till around 4 pm. Meanwhile, some Down fast services leaving CSMT and Up fast/semi-fast train services leaving Kalyan will be diverted.

400.title: Proposal to create 79 posts in Thane's disaster response team approved
400.article_body: Maharashtra CM Eknath Shinde on Friday approved the proposal to create 79 posts in the Disaster Response Team of Thane Municipal Corporation (TMC) due to increasing urbanisation and natural calamities. "Now there will be 79 more posts, including the post of commandant of Class II, three deputy commandant of Class III and 75...responders," Thane's Regional Disaster Management Cell chief said.
